content: 1 After the death of Joshua, the Israelites inquired of the LORD, “Which of us shall be the first to go up against the Canaanites and attack them?”
content_old: 1 After the death of Joshua, the Israelites inquired of the LORD, “Which of us shall be the first to go up against the Canaanites and attack them?”

content: 2 The LORD replied, “Let Judah go up. I now deliver the land into their hands.”
content_old: 2 The LORD replied, “Let Judah go up. I now deliver the land into their hands.”

content: 3 Judah then said to their brother-tribe Simeon, “Come up with us to our allotted territory and let us attack the Canaanites, and then we will go with you to your allotted territory.” So Simeon joined them.
content_old: 3 Judah then said to their brother-tribe Simeon, “Come up with us to our allotted territory and let us attack the Canaanites, and then we will go with you to your allotted territory.” So Simeon joined them.

content: 4 When Judah advanced, the LORD delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hands, and they defeated ten thousand of them at Bezek.
content_old: 4 When Judah advanced, the LORD delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hands, and they defeated ten thousand of them at Bezek.

content: 5 At Bezek, they encountered Adoni-bezek, engaged him in battle, and defeated the Canaanites and the Perizzites.
content_old: 5 At Bezek, they encountered Adoni-bezek, engaged him in battle, and defeated the Canaanites and the Perizzites.

content: 6 Adoni-bezek fled, but they pursued him and captured him; and they cut off his thumbs and his big toes.
content_old: 6 Adoni-bezek fled, but they pursued him and captured him; and they cut off his thumbs and his big toes.

content: 7 And Adoni-bezek said, “Seventy kings, with thumbs and big toes cut off, used to pick up scraps under my table; as I have done, so God has requited me.” They brought him to Jerusalem and he died there.
content_old: 7 And Adoni-bezek said, “Seventy kings, with thumbs and big toes cut off, used to pick up scraps under my table; as I have done, so God has requited me.” They brought him to Jerusalem and he died there.

content: 8 The Judites attacked Jerusalem and captured it; they put it to the sword and set the city on fire.
content_old: 8 The Judites attacked Jerusalem and captured it; they put it to the sword and set the city on fire.

content: 9 After that the Judites went down to attack the Canaanites who inhabited the hill country, the Negeb, and the Shephelah.
content_old: 9 After that the Judites went down to attack the Canaanites who inhabited the hill country, the Negeb, and the Shephelah.

content: 10 The Judites marched against the Canaanites who dwelt in Hebron, and they defeated Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai.
content_old: 10 The Judites marched against the Canaanites who dwelt in Hebron, and they defeated Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai.

content: 11 From there they marched against the inhabitants of Debir the name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher).
content_old: 11 From there they marched against the inhabitants of Debir the name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher).

content: 12 And Caleb announced, “I will give my daughter Achsah in marriage to the man who attacks and captures Kiriath-sepher.”
content_old: 12 And Caleb announced, “I will give my daughter Achsah in marriage to the man who attacks and captures Kiriath-sepher.”

content: 13 His younger kinsman, Othniel the Kenizzite, captured it; and Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah in marriage.
content_old: 13 His younger kinsman, Othniel the Kenizzite, captured it; and Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah in marriage.

content: 14 When she came to him, she induced him to ask her father for some property. She dismounted from her donkey, and Caleb asked her, “What is the matter?”
content_old: 14 When she came to him, she induced him to ask her father for some property. She dismounted from her donkey, and Caleb asked her, “What is the matter?”

content: 15 She replied, “Give me a present, for you have given me away as Negeb-land; give me springs of water.” And Caleb gave her Upper and Lower Gulloth.
content_old: 15 She replied, “Give me a present, for you have given me away as Negeb-land; give me springs of water.” And Caleb gave her Upper and Lower Gulloth.

content: 16 The descendants of the Kenite, the father-in-law of Moses, went up with the Judites from the City of Palms to the wilderness of Judah; and they went and settled among the people in the Negeb of Arad.
content_old: 16 The descendants of the Kenite, the father-in-law of Moses, went up with the Judites from the City of Palms to the wilderness of Judah; and they went and settled among the people in the Negeb of Arad.

content: 17 And Judah with its brother-tribe Simeon went on and defeated the Canaanites who dwelt in Zephath. They proscribed it, and so the town was named Hormah.
content_old: 17 And Judah with its brother-tribe Simeon went on and defeated the Canaanites who dwelt in Zephath. They proscribed it, and so the town was named Hormah.

content: 18 And Judah captured Gaza and its territory, Ashkelon and its territory, and Ekron and its territory.
content_old: 18 And Judah captured Gaza and its territory, Ashkelon and its territory, and Ekron and its territory.

content: 19 The LORD was with Judah, so that they took possession of the hill country; but they were not able to dispossess the inhabitants of the plain, for they had iron chariots.
content_old: 19 The LORD was with Judah, so that they took possession of the hill country; but they were not able to dispossess the inhabitants of the plain, for they had iron chariots.

content: 20 They gave Hebron to Caleb, as Moses had promised; and he drove the three Anakites out of there.
content_old: 20 They gave Hebron to Caleb, as Moses had promised; and he drove the three Anakites out of there.

content: 21 The Benjaminites did not dispossess the Jebusite inhabitants of Jerusalem; so the Jebusites have dwelt with the Benjaminites in Jerusalem to this day.
content_old: 21 The Benjaminites did not dispossess the Jebusite inhabitants of Jerusalem; so the Jebusites have dwelt with the Benjaminites in Jerusalem to this day.

content: 22 The House of Joseph, for their part, advanced against Bethel, and the LORD was with them.
content_old: 22 The House of Joseph, for their part, advanced against Bethel, and the LORD was with them.

content: 23 While the House of Joseph were scouting at Bethel the name of the town was formerly Luz,
content_old: 23 While the House of Joseph were scouting at Bethel the name of the town was formerly Luz,

content: 24 their patrols saw a man leaving the town. They said to him, “Just show us how to get into the town, and we will treat you kindly.”
content_old: 24 their patrols saw a man leaving the town. They said to him, “Just show us how to get into the town, and we will treat you kindly.”

content: 25 He showed them how to get into the town; they put the town to the sword, but they let the man and all his relatives go free.
content_old: 25 He showed them how to get into the town; they put the town to the sword, but they let the man and all his relatives go free.

content: 26 The man went to the Hittite country. He founded a city and named it Luz, and that has been its name to this day.
content_old: 26 The man went to the Hittite country. He founded a city and named it Luz, and that has been its name to this day.

content: 27 Manasseh did not dispossess the inhabitants of Beth-shean and its dependencies, or Taanach and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Dor and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Ibleam and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Megiddo and its dependencies. The Canaanites persisted in dwelling in this region.
content_old: 27 Manasseh did not dispossess the inhabitants of Beth-shean and its dependencies, or Taanach and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Dor and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Ibleam and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Megiddo and its dependencies. The Canaanites persisted in dwelling in this region.

content: 28 And when Israel gained the upper hand, they subjected the Canaanites to forced labor; but they did not dispossess them.
content_old: 28 And when Israel gained the upper hand, they subjected the Canaanites to forced labor; but they did not dispossess them.

content: 29 Nor did Ephraim dispossess the Canaanites who inhabited Gezer; so the Canaanites dwelt in their midst at Gezer.
content_old: 29 Nor did Ephraim dispossess the Canaanites who inhabited Gezer; so the Canaanites dwelt in their midst at Gezer.

content: 30 Zebulun did not dispossess the inhabitants of Kitron or the inhabitants of Nahalol; so the Canaanites dwelt in their midst, but they were subjected to forced labor.
content_old: 30 Zebulun did not dispossess the inhabitants of Kitron or the inhabitants of Nahalol; so the Canaanites dwelt in their midst, but they were subjected to forced labor.

content: 31 Asher did not dispossess the inhabitants of Acco or the inhabitants of Sidon, Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Aphik, and Rehob.
content_old: 31 Asher did not dispossess the inhabitants of Acco or the inhabitants of Sidon, Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Aphik, and Rehob.

content: 32 So the Asherites dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land, for they did not dispossess them.
content_old: 32 So the Asherites dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land, for they did not dispossess them.

content: 33 Naphtali did not dispossess the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh or the inhabitants of Beth-anath. But they settled in the midst of the Canaanite inhabitants of the land, and the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh and Beth-anath had to perform forced labor for them.
content_old: 33 Naphtali did not dispossess the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh or the inhabitants of Beth-anath. But they settled in the midst of the Canaanite inhabitants of the land, and the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh and Beth-anath had to perform forced labor for them.

content: 34 The Amorites pressed the Danites into the hill country; they would not let them come down to the plain.
content_old: 34 The Amorites pressed the Danites into the hill country; they would not let them come down to the plain.

content: 35 The Amorites also persisted in dwelling in Har-heres, in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim. But the hand of the House of Joseph bore heavily on them and they had to perform forced labor.
content_old: 35 The Amorites also persisted in dwelling in Har-heres, in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim. But the hand of the House of Joseph bore heavily on them and they had to perform forced labor.

content: 1 An angel of the LORD came up from Gilgal to Bochim and said, “I brought you up from Egypt and I took you into the land which I had promised on oath to your fathers. And I said, ‘I will never break My covenant with you.
content_old: 1 An angel of the LORD came up from Gilgal to Bochim and said, “I brought you up from Egypt and I took you into the land which I had promised on oath to your fathers. And I said, ‘I will never break My covenant with you.

content: 2 And you, for your part, must make no covenant with the inhabitants of this land; you must tear down their altars.’ But you have not obeyed Me—look what you have done!
content_old: 2 And you, for your part, must make no covenant with the inhabitants of this land; you must tear down their altars.’ But you have not obeyed Me—look what you have done!

content: 3 Therefore, I have resolved not to drive them out before you; they shall become your oppressors, and their gods shall be a snare to you.”
content_old: 3 Therefore, I have resolved not to drive them out before you; they shall become your oppressors, and their gods shall be a snare to you.”

content: 4 As the angel of the LORD spoke these words to all the Israelites, the people broke into weeping.
content_old: 4 As the angel of the LORD spoke these words to all the Israelites, the people broke into weeping.

content: 5 So they named that place Bochim, and they offered sacrifices there to the LORD.
content_old: 5 So they named that place Bochim, and they offered sacrifices there to the LORD.

content: 6 When Joshua dismissed the people, the Israelites went to their allotted territories and took possession of the land.
content_old: 6 When Joshua dismissed the people, the Israelites went to their allotted territories and took possession of the land.

content: 7 The people served the LORD during the lifetime of Joshua and the lifetime of the older people who lived on after Joshua and who had witnessed all the marvelous deeds that the LORD had wrought for Israel.
content_old: 7 The people served the LORD during the lifetime of Joshua and the lifetime of the older people who lived on after Joshua and who had witnessed all the marvelous deeds that the LORD had wrought for Israel.

content: 8 Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died at the age of one hundred and ten years,
content_old: 8 Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died at the age of one hundred and ten years,

content: 9 and was buried on his own property, at Timnath-heres in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
content_old: 9 and was buried on his own property, at Timnath-heres in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.

content: 10 And all that generation were likewise gathered to their fathers. Another generation arose after them, which had not experienced the LORD or the deeds that He had wrought for Israel.
content_old: 10 And all that generation were likewise gathered to their fathers. Another generation arose after them, which had not experienced the LORD or the deeds that He had wrought for Israel.

content: 11 And the Israelites did what was offensive to the LORD. They worshiped the Baalim
content_old: 11 And the Israelites did what was offensive to the LORD. They worshiped the Baalim

content: 12 and forsook the LORD, the God of their fathers, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt. They followed other gods, from among the gods of the peoples around them, and bowed down to them; they provoked the LORD.
content_old: 12 and forsook the LORD, the God of their fathers, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt. They followed other gods, from among the gods of the peoples around them, and bowed down to them; they provoked the LORD.

content: 13 They forsook the LORD and worshiped Baal and the Ashtaroth.
content_old: 13 They forsook the LORD and worshiped Baal and the Ashtaroth.

content: 14 Then the LORD was incensed at Israel, and He handed them over to foes who plundered them. He surrendered them to their enemies on all sides, and they could no longer hold their own against their enemies.
content_old: 14 Then the LORD was incensed at Israel, and He handed them over to foes who plundered them. He surrendered them to their enemies on all sides, and they could no longer hold their own against their enemies.

content: 15 In all their campaigns, the hand of the LORD was against them to their undoing, as the LORD had declared and as the LORD had sworn to them; and they were in great distress.
content_old: 15 In all their campaigns, the hand of the LORD was against them to their undoing, as the LORD had declared and as the LORD had sworn to them; and they were in great distress.

content: 16 Then the LORD raised up chieftains who delivered them from those who plundered them.
content_old: 16 Then the LORD raised up chieftains who delivered them from those who plundered them.

content: 17 But they did not heed their chieftains either; they went astray after other gods and bowed down to them. They were quick to turn aside from the way their fathers had followed in obedience to the commandments of the LORD; they did not do right.
content_old: 17 But they did not heed their chieftains either; they went astray after other gods and bowed down to them. They were quick to turn aside from the way their fathers had followed in obedience to the commandments of the LORD; they did not do right.

content: 18 When the LORD raised up chieftains for them, the LORD would be with the chieftain and would save them from their enemies during the chieftain’s lifetime; for the LORD would be moved to pity by their moanings because of those who oppressed and crushed them.
content_old: 18 When the LORD raised up chieftains for them, the LORD would be with the chieftain and would save them from their enemies during the chieftain’s lifetime; for the LORD would be moved to pity by their moanings because of those who oppressed and crushed them.

content: 19 But when the chieftain died, they would again act basely, even more than the preceding generation—following other gods, worshiping them, and bowing down to them; they omitted none of their practices and stubborn ways.
content_old: 19 But when the chieftain died, they would again act basely, even more than the preceding generation—following other gods, worshiping them, and bowing down to them; they omitted none of their practices and stubborn ways.

content: 20 Then the LORD became incensed against Israel, and He said, “Since that nation has transgressed the covenant that I enjoined upon their fathers and has not obeyed Me,
content_old: 20 Then the LORD became incensed against Israel, and He said, “Since that nation has transgressed the covenant that I enjoined upon their fathers and has not obeyed Me,

content: 21 I for My part will no longer drive out before them any of the nations that Joshua left when he died.”
content_old: 21 I for My part will no longer drive out before them any of the nations that Joshua left when he died.”

content: 22 For it was in order to test Israel by them—whether or not they would faithfully walk in the ways of the LORD, as their fathers had done—
content_old: 22 For it was in order to test Israel by them—whether or not they would faithfully walk in the ways of the LORD, as their fathers had done—

content: 1 These are the nations that the LORD left so that He might test by them all the Israelites who had not known any of the wars of Canaan,
content_old: 1 These are the nations that the LORD left so that He might test by them all the Israelites who had not known any of the wars of Canaan,

content: 2 so that succeeding generations of Israelites might be made to experience war—but only those who had not known the former wars:
content_old: 2 so that succeeding generations of Israelites might be made to experience war—but only those who had not known the former wars:

content: 3 the five principalities of the Philistines and all the Canaanites, Sidonians, and Hivites who inhabited the hill country of the Lebanon from Mount Baal-hermon to Lebo-hamath.
content_old: 3 the five principalities of the Philistines and all the Canaanites, Sidonians, and Hivites who inhabited the hill country of the Lebanon from Mount Baal-hermon to Lebo-hamath.

content: 4 These served as a means of testing Israel, to learn whether they would obey the commandments which the LORD had enjoined upon their fathers through Moses.
content_old: 4 These served as a means of testing Israel, to learn whether they would obey the commandments which the LORD had enjoined upon their fathers through Moses.

content: 5 The Israelites settled among the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites;
content_old: 5 The Israelites settled among the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites;

content: 6 they took their daughters to wife and gave their own daughters to their sons, and they worshiped their gods.
content_old: 6 they took their daughters to wife and gave their own daughters to their sons, and they worshiped their gods.

content: 7 The Israelites did what was offensive to the LORD; they ignored the LORD their God and worshiped the Baalim and the Asheroth.
content_old: 7 The Israelites did what was offensive to the LORD; they ignored the LORD their God and worshiped the Baalim and the Asheroth.

content: 8 The LORD became incensed at Israel and surrendered them to King Cushan-rishathaim of Aram-naharaim; and the Israelites were subject to Cushan-rishathaim for eight years.
content_old: 8 The LORD became incensed at Israel and surrendered them to King Cushan-rishathaim of Aram-naharaim; and the Israelites were subject to Cushan-rishathaim for eight years.

content: 9 The Israelites cried out to the LORD, and the LORD raised a champion for the Israelites to deliver them: Othniel the Kenizzite, a younger kinsman of Caleb.
content_old: 9 The Israelites cried out to the LORD, and the LORD raised a champion for the Israelites to deliver them: Othniel the Kenizzite, a younger kinsman of Caleb.

content: 10 The spirit of the LORD descended upon him and he became Israel’s chieftain. He went out to war, and the LORD delivered King Cushan-rishathaim of Aram into his hands. He prevailed over Cushan-rishathaim,
content_old: 10 The spirit of the LORD descended upon him and he became Israel’s chieftain. He went out to war, and the LORD delivered King Cushan-rishathaim of Aram into his hands. He prevailed over Cushan-rishathaim,

content: 11 and the land had peace for forty years. When Othniel the Kenizzite died,
content_old: 11 and the land had peace for forty years. When Othniel the Kenizzite died,

content: 12 the Israelites again did what was offensive to the LORD. And because they did what was offensive to the LORD, the LORD let King Eglon of Moab prevail over Israel.
content_old: 12 the Israelites again did what was offensive to the LORD. And because they did what was offensive to the LORD, the LORD let King Eglon of Moab prevail over Israel.

content: 13 brought the Ammonites and the Amalekites together under his command, and went and defeated Israel and occupied the City of Palms.
content_old: 13 brought the Ammonites and the Amalekites together under his command, and went and defeated Israel and occupied the City of Palms.

content: 14 The Israelites were subject to King Eglon of Moab for eighteen years.
content_old: 14 The Israelites were subject to King Eglon of Moab for eighteen years.

content: 15 Then the Israelites cried out to the LORD, and the LORD raised up a champion for them: the Benjaminite Ehud son of Gera, a left-handed man. It happened that the Israelites sent tribute to King Eglon of Moab through him.
content_old: 15 Then the Israelites cried out to the LORD, and the LORD raised up a champion for them: the Benjaminite Ehud son of Gera, a left-handed man. It happened that the Israelites sent tribute to King Eglon of Moab through him.

content: 16 So Ehud made for himself a two-edged dagger, a gomed in length, which he girded on his right side under his cloak.
content_old: 16 So Ehud made for himself a two-edged dagger, a gomed in length, which he girded on his right side under his cloak.

content: 17 He presented the tribute to King Eglon of Moab. Now Eglon was a very stout man.
content_old: 17 He presented the tribute to King Eglon of Moab. Now Eglon was a very stout man.

content: 18 When Ehud had finished presenting the tribute, he dismissed the people who had conveyed the tribute.
content_old: 18 When Ehud had finished presenting the tribute, he dismissed the people who had conveyed the tribute.

content: 19 But he himself returned from Pesilim, near Gilgal, and said, “Your Majesty, I have a secret message for you.” thereupon commanded, “Silence!” So all those in attendance left his presence;
content_old: 19 But he himself returned from Pesilim, near Gilgal, and said, “Your Majesty, I have a secret message for you.” thereupon commanded, “Silence!” So all those in attendance left his presence;

content: 20 and when Ehud approached him, he was sitting alone in his cool upper chamber. Ehud said, “I have a message for you from God”; whereupon he rose from his seat.
content_old: 20 and when Ehud approached him, he was sitting alone in his cool upper chamber. Ehud said, “I have a message for you from God”; whereupon he rose from his seat.

content: 21 Reaching with his left hand, Ehud drew the dagger from his right side and drove it into Eglon��s belly.
content_old: 21 Reaching with his left hand, Ehud drew the dagger from his right side and drove it into Eglon��s belly.

content: 22 The fat closed over the blade and the hilt went in after the blade—for he did not pull the dagger out of his belly—and the filth came out.
content_old: 22 The fat closed over the blade and the hilt went in after the blade—for he did not pull the dagger out of his belly—and the filth came out.

content: 23 Stepping out into the vestibule, Ehud shut the doors of the upper chamber on him and locked them.
content_old: 23 Stepping out into the vestibule, Ehud shut the doors of the upper chamber on him and locked them.

content: 24 After he left, the courtiers returned. When they saw that the doors of the upper chamber were locked, they thought, “He must be relieving himself in the cool chamber.”
content_old: 24 After he left, the courtiers returned. When they saw that the doors of the upper chamber were locked, they thought, “He must be relieving himself in the cool chamber.”

content: 25 They waited a long time; and when he did not open the doors of the chamber, they took the key and opened them—and there their master was lying dead on the floor!
content_old: 25 They waited a long time; and when he did not open the doors of the chamber, they took the key and opened them—and there their master was lying dead on the floor!

content: 26 But Ehud had made good his escape while they delayed; he had passed Pesilim and escaped to Seirah.
content_old: 26 But Ehud had made good his escape while they delayed; he had passed Pesilim and escaped to Seirah.

content: 27 When he got there, he had the ram’s horn sounded through the hill country of Ephraim, and all the Israelites descended with him from the hill country; and he took the lead.
content_old: 27 When he got there, he had the ram’s horn sounded through the hill country of Ephraim, and all the Israelites descended with him from the hill country; and he took the lead.

content: 28 “Follow me closely,” he said, “for the LORD has delivered your enemies, the Moabites, into your hands.” They followed him down and seized the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites; they let no one cross.
content_old: 28 “Follow me closely,” he said, “for the LORD has delivered your enemies, the Moabites, into your hands.” They followed him down and seized the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites; they let no one cross.

content: 29 On that occasion they slew about 10,000 Moabites; they were all robust and brave men, yet not one of them escaped.
content_old: 29 On that occasion they slew about 10,000 Moabites; they were all robust and brave men, yet not one of them escaped.

content: 30 On that day, Moab submitted to Israel; and the land was tranquil for eighty years.
content_old: 30 On that day, Moab submitted to Israel; and the land was tranquil for eighty years.

content: 1 The Israelites again did what was offensive to the LORD—Ehud now being dead.
content_old: 1 The Israelites again did what was offensive to the LORD—Ehud now being dead.

content: 2 And the LORD surrendered them to King Jabin of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor. His army commander was Sisera, whose base was Harosheth-goiim.
content_old: 2 And the LORD surrendered them to King Jabin of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor. His army commander was Sisera, whose base was Harosheth-goiim.

content: 3 The Israelites cried out to the LORD; for he had nine hundred iron chariots, and he had oppressed Israel ruthlessly for twenty years.
content_old: 3 The Israelites cried out to the LORD; for he had nine hundred iron chariots, and he had oppressed Israel ruthlessly for twenty years.

content: 4 Deborah, wife of Lappidoth, was a prophetess; she led Israel at that time.
content_old: 4 Deborah, wife of Lappidoth, was a prophetess; she led Israel at that time.

content: 5 She used to sit under the Palm of Deborah, between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim, and the Israelites would come to her for decisions.
content_old: 5 She used to sit under the Palm of Deborah, between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim, and the Israelites would come to her for decisions.

content: 6 She summoned Barak son of Abinoam, of Kedesh in Naphtali, and said to him, “The LORD, the God of Israel, has commanded: Go, march up to Mount Tabor, and take with you ten thousand men of Naphtali and Zebulun.
content_old: 6 She summoned Barak son of Abinoam, of Kedesh in Naphtali, and said to him, “The LORD, the God of Israel, has commanded: Go, march up to Mount Tabor, and take with you ten thousand men of Naphtali and Zebulun.

content: 7 And I will draw Sisera, Jabin’s army commander, with his chariots and his troops, toward you up to the Wadi Kishon; and I will deliver him into your hands.”
content_old: 7 And I will draw Sisera, Jabin’s army commander, with his chariots and his troops, toward you up to the Wadi Kishon; and I will deliver him into your hands.”

content: 8 But Barak said to her, “If you will go with me, I will go; if not, I will not go.”
content_old: 8 But Barak said to her, “If you will go with me, I will go; if not, I will not go.”

content: 9 “Very well, I will go with you,” she answered. “However, there will be no glory for you in the course you are taking, for then the LORD will deliver Sisera into the hands of a woman.” So Deborah went with Barak to Kedesh.
content_old: 9 “Very well, I will go with you,” she answered. “However, there will be no glory for you in the course you are taking, for then the LORD will deliver Sisera into the hands of a woman.” So Deborah went with Barak to Kedesh.

content: 10 Barak then mustered Zebulun and Naphtali at Kedesh; ten thousand men marched up after him; and Deborah also went up with him.
content_old: 10 Barak then mustered Zebulun and Naphtali at Kedesh; ten thousand men marched up after him; and Deborah also went up with him.

content: 11 Now Heber the Kenite had separated from the other Kenites, descendants of Hobab, father-in-law of Moses, and had pitched his tent at Elon-bezaanannim, which is near Kedesh.
content_old: 11 Now Heber the Kenite had separated from the other Kenites, descendants of Hobab, father-in-law of Moses, and had pitched his tent at Elon-bezaanannim, which is near Kedesh.

content: 12 Sisera was informed that Barak son of Abinoam had gone up to Mount Tabor.
content_old: 12 Sisera was informed that Barak son of Abinoam had gone up to Mount Tabor.

content: 13 So Sisera ordered all his chariots—nine hundred iron chariots—and all the troops he had to move from Harosheth-goiim to the Wadi Kishon.
content_old: 13 So Sisera ordered all his chariots—nine hundred iron chariots—and all the troops he had to move from Harosheth-goiim to the Wadi Kishon.

content: 14 Then Deborah said to Barak, “Up! This is the day on which the LORD will deliver Sisera into your hands: the LORD is marching before you.” Barak charged down Mount Tabor, followed by the ten thousand men,
content_old: 14 Then Deborah said to Barak, “Up! This is the day on which the LORD will deliver Sisera into your hands: the LORD is marching before you.” Barak charged down Mount Tabor, followed by the ten thousand men,

content: 15 and the LORD threw Sisera and all his chariots and army into a panic before the onslaught of Barak. Sisera leaped from his chariot and fled on foot
content_old: 15 and the LORD threw Sisera and all his chariots and army into a panic before the onslaught of Barak. Sisera leaped from his chariot and fled on foot

content: 16 as Barak pursued the chariots and the soldiers as far as Harosheth-goiim. All of Sisera’s soldiers fell by the sword; not a man was left.
content_old: 16 as Barak pursued the chariots and the soldiers as far as Harosheth-goiim. All of Sisera’s soldiers fell by the sword; not a man was left.

content: 17 Sisera, meanwhile, had fled on foot to the tent of Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite; for there was friendship between King Jabin of Hazor and the family of Heber the Kenite.
content_old: 17 Sisera, meanwhile, had fled on foot to the tent of Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite; for there was friendship between King Jabin of Hazor and the family of Heber the Kenite.

content: 18 Jael came out to greet Sisera and said to him, “Come in, my lord, come in here, do not be afraid.” So he entered her tent, and she covered him with a blanket.
content_old: 18 Jael came out to greet Sisera and said to him, “Come in, my lord, come in here, do not be afraid.” So he entered her tent, and she covered him with a blanket.

content: 19 He said to her, “Please let me have some water; I am thirsty.” She opened a skin of milk and gave him some to drink; and she covered him again.
content_old: 19 He said to her, “Please let me have some water; I am thirsty.” She opened a skin of milk and gave him some to drink; and she covered him again.

content: 20 He said to her, “Stand at the entrance of the tent. If anybody comes and asks you if there is anybody here, say ‘No.’ ”
content_old: 20 He said to her, “Stand at the entrance of the tent. If anybody comes and asks you if there is anybody here, say ‘No.’ ”

content: 21 Then Jael wife of Heber took a tent pin and grasped the mallet. When he was fast asleep from exhaustion, she approached him stealthily and drove the pin through his temple till it went down to the ground. Thus he died.
content_old: 21 Then Jael wife of Heber took a tent pin and grasped the mallet. When he was fast asleep from exhaustion, she approached him stealthily and drove the pin through his temple till it went down to the ground. Thus he died.

content: 22 Now Barak appeared in pursuit of Sisera. Jael went out to greet him and said, “Come, I will show you the man you are looking for.” He went inside with her, and there Sisera was lying dead, with the pin in his temple.
content_old: 22 Now Barak appeared in pursuit of Sisera. Jael went out to greet him and said, “Come, I will show you the man you are looking for.” He went inside with her, and there Sisera was lying dead, with the pin in his temple.

content: 23 On that day God subdued King Jabin of Hazor before the Israelites.
content_old: 23 On that day God subdued King Jabin of Hazor before the Israelites.

content: 1 On that day Deborah and Barak son of Abinoam sang:
content_old: 1 On that day Deborah and Barak son of Abinoam sang:

content: 2 When locks go untrimmed in Israel, When people dedicate themselves— Bless the LORD!
content_old: 2 When locks go untrimmed in Israel, When people dedicate themselves— Bless the LORD!

content: 3 Hear, O kings! Give ear, O potentates! I will sing, will sing to the LORD, Will hymn the LORD, the God of Israel.
content_old: 3 Hear, O kings! Give ear, O potentates! I will sing, will sing to the LORD, Will hymn the LORD, the God of Israel.

content: 4 O LORD, when You came forth from Seir, Advanced from the country of Edom, The earth trembled; The heavens dripped, Yea, the clouds dripped water,
content_old: 4 O LORD, when You came forth from Seir, Advanced from the country of Edom, The earth trembled; The heavens dripped, Yea, the clouds dripped water,

content: 5 The mountains quaked— Before the LORD, Him of Sinai, Before the LORD, God of Israel.
content_old: 5 The mountains quaked— Before the LORD, Him of Sinai, Before the LORD, God of Israel.

content: 6 In the days of Shamgar son of Anath, In the days of Jael, caravans ceased, And wayfarers went By roundabout paths.
content_old: 6 In the days of Shamgar son of Anath, In the days of Jael, caravans ceased, And wayfarers went By roundabout paths.

content: 7 Deliverance ceased, Ceased in Israel, Till you arose, O Deborah, Arose, O mother, in Israel!
content_old: 7 Deliverance ceased, Ceased in Israel, Till you arose, O Deborah, Arose, O mother, in Israel!

content: 8 When they chose new gods, Was there a fighter then in the gates? No shield or spear was seen Among forty thousand in Israel!
content_old: 8 When they chose new gods, Was there a fighter then in the gates? No shield or spear was seen Among forty thousand in Israel!

content: 9 My heart is with Israel’s leaders, With the dedicated of the people— Bless the LORD!
content_old: 9 My heart is with Israel’s leaders, With the dedicated of the people— Bless the LORD!

content: 10 You riders on tawny she-asses, You who sit on saddle rugs, And you wayfarers, declare it!
content_old: 10 You riders on tawny she-asses, You who sit on saddle rugs, And you wayfarers, declare it!

content: 11 Louder than the sound of archers, There among the watering places Let them chant the gracious acts of the LORD, His gracious deliverance of Israel. Then did the people of the LORD March down to the gates!
content_old: 11 Louder than the sound of archers, There among the watering places Let them chant the gracious acts of the LORD, His gracious deliverance of Israel. Then did the people of the LORD March down to the gates!

content: 12 Awake, awake, O Deborah! Awake, awake, strike up the chant! Arise, O Barak; Take your captives, O son of Abinoam!
content_old: 12 Awake, awake, O Deborah! Awake, awake, strike up the chant! Arise, O Barak; Take your captives, O son of Abinoam!

content: 13 Then was the remnant made victor over the mighty, The LORD’s people won my victory over the warriors.
content_old: 13 Then was the remnant made victor over the mighty, The LORD’s people won my victory over the warriors.

content: 14 From Ephraim came they whose roots are in Amalek; After you, your kin Benjamin; From Machir came down leaders, From Zebulun such as hold the marshal’s staff.
content_old: 14 From Ephraim came they whose roots are in Amalek; After you, your kin Benjamin; From Machir came down leaders, From Zebulun such as hold the marshal’s staff.

content: 15 And Issachar’s chiefs were with Deborah; As Barak, so was Issachar— Rushing after him into the valley. Among the clans of Reuben Were great decisions of heart.
content_old: 15 And Issachar’s chiefs were with Deborah; As Barak, so was Issachar— Rushing after him into the valley. Among the clans of Reuben Were great decisions of heart.

content: 16 Why then did you stay among the sheepfolds And listen as they pipe for the flocks? Among the clans of Reuben Were great searchings of heart!
content_old: 16 Why then did you stay among the sheepfolds And listen as they pipe for the flocks? Among the clans of Reuben Were great searchings of heart!

content: 17 Gilead tarried beyond the Jordan; And Dan—why did he linger by the ships? Asher remained at the seacoast And tarried at his landings.
content_old: 17 Gilead tarried beyond the Jordan; And Dan—why did he linger by the ships? Asher remained at the seacoast And tarried at his landings.

content: 18 Zebulun is a people that mocked at death, Naphtali—on the open heights.
content_old: 18 Zebulun is a people that mocked at death, Naphtali—on the open heights.

content: 19 Then the kings came, they fought: The kings of Canaan fought At Taanach, by Megiddo’s waters— They got no spoil of silver.
content_old: 19 Then the kings came, they fought: The kings of Canaan fought At Taanach, by Megiddo’s waters— They got no spoil of silver.

content: 20 The stars fought from heaven, From their courses they fought against Sisera.
content_old: 20 The stars fought from heaven, From their courses they fought against Sisera.

content: 21 The torrent Kishon swept them away, The raging torrent, the torrent Kishon. March on, my soul, with courage!
content_old: 21 The torrent Kishon swept them away, The raging torrent, the torrent Kishon. March on, my soul, with courage!

content: 22 Then the horses’ hoofs pounded As headlong galloped the steeds.
content_old: 22 Then the horses’ hoofs pounded As headlong galloped the steeds.

content: 23 “Curse Meroz!” said the angel of the LORD. “Bitterly curse its inhabitants, Because they came not to the aid of the LORD, To the aid of the LORD among the warriors.”
content_old: 23 “Curse Meroz!” said the angel of the LORD. “Bitterly curse its inhabitants, Because they came not to the aid of the LORD, To the aid of the LORD among the warriors.”

content: 24 Most blessed of women be Jael, Wife of Heber the Kenite, Most blessed of women in tents.
content_old: 24 Most blessed of women be Jael, Wife of Heber the Kenite, Most blessed of women in tents.

content: 25 He asked for water, she offered milk; In a princely bowl she brought him curds.
content_old: 25 He asked for water, she offered milk; In a princely bowl she brought him curds.

content: 26 Her hand reached for the tent pin, Her right for the workmen’s hammer. She struck Sisera, crushed his head, Smashed and pierced his temple.
content_old: 26 Her hand reached for the tent pin, Her right for the workmen’s hammer. She struck Sisera, crushed his head, Smashed and pierced his temple.

content: 27 At her feet he sank, lay outstretched, At her feet he sank, lay still; Where he sank, there he lay—destroyed.
content_old: 27 At her feet he sank, lay outstretched, At her feet he sank, lay still; Where he sank, there he lay—destroyed.

content: 28 Through the window peered Sisera’s mother, Behind the lattice she whined: “Why is his chariot so long in coming? Why so late the clatter of his wheels?”
content_old: 28 Through the window peered Sisera’s mother, Behind the lattice she whined: “Why is his chariot so long in coming? Why so late the clatter of his wheels?”

content: 29 The wisest of her ladies give answer; She, too, replies to herself:
content_old: 29 The wisest of her ladies give answer; She, too, replies to herself:

content: 30 “They must be dividing the spoil they have found: A damsel or two for each man, Spoil of dyed cloths for Sisera, Spoil of embroidered cloths, A couple of embroidered cloths Round every neck as spoil.”
content_old: 30 “They must be dividing the spoil they have found: A damsel or two for each man, Spoil of dyed cloths for Sisera, Spoil of embroidered cloths, A couple of embroidered cloths Round every neck as spoil.”

content: 1 Then the Israelites did what was offensive to the LORD, and the LORD delivered them into the hands of the Midianites for seven years.
content_old: 1 Then the Israelites did what was offensive to the LORD, and the LORD delivered them into the hands of the Midianites for seven years.

content: 2 The hand of the Midianites prevailed over Israel; and because of Midian, the Israelites provided themselves with refuges in the caves and strongholds of the mountains.
content_old: 2 The hand of the Midianites prevailed over Israel; and because of Midian, the Israelites provided themselves with refuges in the caves and strongholds of the mountains.

content: 3 After the Israelites had done their sowing, Midian, Amalek, and the Kedemites would come up and raid them;
content_old: 3 After the Israelites had done their sowing, Midian, Amalek, and the Kedemites would come up and raid them;

content: 4 they would attack them, destroy the produce of the land all the way to Gaza, and leave no means of sustenance in Israel, not a sheep or an ox or an ass.
content_old: 4 they would attack them, destroy the produce of the land all the way to Gaza, and leave no means of sustenance in Israel, not a sheep or an ox or an ass.

content: 5 For they would come up with their livestock and their tents, swarming as thick as locusts; they and their camels were innumerable. Thus they would invade the land and ravage it.
content_old: 5 For they would come up with their livestock and their tents, swarming as thick as locusts; they and their camels were innumerable. Thus they would invade the land and ravage it.

content: 6 Israel was reduced to utter misery by the Midianites, and the Israelites cried out to the LORD.
content_old: 6 Israel was reduced to utter misery by the Midianites, and the Israelites cried out to the LORD.

content: 7 When the Israelites cried to the LORD on account of Midian,
content_old: 7 When the Israelites cried to the LORD on account of Midian,

content: 8 the LORD sent a prophet to the Israelites who said to them, “Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: I brought you up out of Egypt and freed you from the house of bondage.
content_old: 8 the LORD sent a prophet to the Israelites who said to them, “Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel: I brought you up out of Egypt and freed you from the house of bondage.

content: 9 I rescued you from the Egyptians and from all your oppressors; I drove them out before you, and gave you their land.
content_old: 9 I rescued you from the Egyptians and from all your oppressors; I drove them out before you, and gave you their land.

content: 10 And I said to you, ‘I the LORD am your God. You must not worship the gods of the Amorites in whose land you dwell.’ But you did not obey Me.”
content_old: 10 And I said to you, ‘I the LORD am your God. You must not worship the gods of the Amorites in whose land you dwell.’ But you did not obey Me.”

content: 11 An angel of the LORD came and sat under the terebinth at Ophrah, which belonged to Joash the Abiezrite. His son Gideon was then beating out wheat inside a winepress in order to keep it safe from the Midianites.
content_old: 11 An angel of the LORD came and sat under the terebinth at Ophrah, which belonged to Joash the Abiezrite. His son Gideon was then beating out wheat inside a winepress in order to keep it safe from the Midianites.

content: 12 The angel of the LORD appeared to him and said to him, “The LORD is with you, valiant warrior!”
content_old: 12 The angel of the LORD appeared to him and said to him, “The LORD is with you, valiant warrior!”

content: 13 Gideon said to him, “Please, my lord, if the LORD is with us, why has all this befallen us? Where are all His wondrous deeds about which our fathers told us, saying, ‘Truly the LORD brought us up from Egypt’? Now the LORD has abandoned us and delivered us into the hands of Midian!”
content_old: 13 Gideon said to him, “Please, my lord, if the LORD is with us, why has all this befallen us? Where are all His wondrous deeds about which our fathers told us, saying, ‘Truly the LORD brought us up from Egypt’? Now the LORD has abandoned us and delivered us into the hands of Midian!”

content: 14 The LORD turned to him and said, “Go in this strength of yours and deliver Israel from the Midianites. I herewith make you My messenger.”
content_old: 14 The LORD turned to him and said, “Go in this strength of yours and deliver Israel from the Midianites. I herewith make you My messenger.”

content: 15 He said to Him, “Please, my lord, how can I deliver Israel? Why, my clan is the humblest in Manasseh, and I am the youngest in my father’s household.”
content_old: 15 He said to Him, “Please, my lord, how can I deliver Israel? Why, my clan is the humblest in Manasseh, and I am the youngest in my father’s household.”

content: 16 The LORD replied, “I will be with you, and you shall defeat Midian to a man.”
content_old: 16 The LORD replied, “I will be with you, and you shall defeat Midian to a man.”

content: 17 And he said to Him, “If I have gained Your favor, give me a sign that it is You who are speaking to me:
content_old: 17 And he said to Him, “If I have gained Your favor, give me a sign that it is You who are speaking to me:

content: 18 do not leave this place until I come back to You and bring out my offering and place it before You.” And He answered, “I will stay until you return.”
content_old: 18 do not leave this place until I come back to You and bring out my offering and place it before You.” And He answered, “I will stay until you return.”

content: 19 So Gideon went in and prepared a kid, and unleavened bread from an ephah of flour. He put the meat in a basket and poured the broth into a pot, and he brought them out to Him under the terebinth. As he presented them,
content_old: 19 So Gideon went in and prepared a kid, and unleavened bread from an ephah of flour. He put the meat in a basket and poured the broth into a pot, and he brought them out to Him under the terebinth. As he presented them,

content: 20 the angel of God said to him, “Take the meat and the unleavened bread, put them on yonder rock, and spill out the broth.” He did so.
content_old: 20 the angel of God said to him, “Take the meat and the unleavened bread, put them on yonder rock, and spill out the broth.” He did so.

content: 21 The angel of the LORD held out the staff that he carried, and touched the meat and the unleavened bread with its tip. A fire sprang up from the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened bread. And the angel of the LORD vanished from his sight.
content_old: 21 The angel of the LORD held out the staff that he carried, and touched the meat and the unleavened bread with its tip. A fire sprang up from the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened bread. And the angel of the LORD vanished from his sight.

content: 22 Then Gideon realized that it was an angel of the LORD; and Gideon said, “Alas, O Lord GOD! For I have seen an angel of the LORD face to face.”
content_old: 22 Then Gideon realized that it was an angel of the LORD; and Gideon said, “Alas, O Lord GOD! For I have seen an angel of the LORD face to face.”

content: 23 But the LORD said to him, “All is well; have no fear, you shall not die.”
content_old: 23 But the LORD said to him, “All is well; have no fear, you shall not die.”

content: 24 So Gideon built there an altar to the LORD and called it Adonai-shalom. To this day it stands in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
content_old: 24 So Gideon built there an altar to the LORD and called it Adonai-shalom. To this day it stands in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

content: 25 That night the LORD said to him: “Take the young bull belonging to your father and another bull seven years old; pull down the altar of Baal which belongs to your father, and cut down the sacred post which is beside it.
content_old: 25 That night the LORD said to him: “Take the young bull belonging to your father and another bull seven years old; pull down the altar of Baal which belongs to your father, and cut down the sacred post which is beside it.

content: 26 Then build an altar to the LORD your God, on the level ground on top of this stronghold. Take the other bull and offer it as a burnt offering, using the wood of the sacred post that you have cut down.”
content_old: 26 Then build an altar to the LORD your God, on the level ground on top of this stronghold. Take the other bull and offer it as a burnt offering, using the wood of the sacred post that you have cut down.”

content: 27 So Gideon took ten of his servants and did as the LORD had told him; but as he was afraid to do it by day, on account of his father’s household and the townspeople, he did it by night.
content_old: 27 So Gideon took ten of his servants and did as the LORD had told him; but as he was afraid to do it by day, on account of his father’s household and the townspeople, he did it by night.

content: 28 Early the next morning, the townspeople found that the altar of Baal had been torn down and the sacred post beside it had been cut down, and that the second bull had been offered on the newly built altar.
content_old: 28 Early the next morning, the townspeople found that the altar of Baal had been torn down and the sacred post beside it had been cut down, and that the second bull had been offered on the newly built altar.

content: 29 They said to one another, “Who did this thing?” Upon inquiry and investigation, they were told, “Gideon son of Joash did this thing!”
content_old: 29 They said to one another, “Who did this thing?” Upon inquiry and investigation, they were told, “Gideon son of Joash did this thing!”

content: 30 The townspeople said to Joash, “Bring out your son, for he must die: he has torn down the altar of Baal and cut down the sacred post beside it!”
content_old: 30 The townspeople said to Joash, “Bring out your son, for he must die: he has torn down the altar of Baal and cut down the sacred post beside it!”

content: 31 But Joash said to all who had risen against him, “Do you have to contend for Baal? Do you have to vindicate him? Whoever fights his battles shall be dead by morning! If he is a god, let him fight his own battles, since it is his altar that has been torn down!”
content_old: 31 But Joash said to all who had risen against him, “Do you have to contend for Baal? Do you have to vindicate him? Whoever fights his battles shall be dead by morning! If he is a god, let him fight his own battles, since it is his altar that has been torn down!”

content: 32 That day they named him Jerubbaal, meaning “Let Baal contend with him, since he tore down his altar.”
content_old: 32 That day they named him Jerubbaal, meaning “Let Baal contend with him, since he tore down his altar.”

content: 33 All Midian, Amalek, and the Kedemites joined forces; they crossed over and encamped in the Valley of Jezreel.
content_old: 33 All Midian, Amalek, and the Kedemites joined forces; they crossed over and encamped in the Valley of Jezreel.

content: 34 The spirit of the LORD enveloped Gideon; he sounded the horn, and the Abiezrites rallied behind him.
content_old: 34 The spirit of the LORD enveloped Gideon; he sounded the horn, and the Abiezrites rallied behind him.

content: 35 And he sent messengers throughout Manasseh, and they too rallied behind him. He then sent messengers through Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali, and they came up to meet the Manassites.
content_old: 35 And he sent messengers throughout Manasseh, and they too rallied behind him. He then sent messengers through Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali, and they came up to meet the Manassites.

content: 36 And Gideon said to God, “If You really intend to deliver Israel through me as You have said—
content_old: 36 And Gideon said to God, “If You really intend to deliver Israel through me as You have said—

content: 37 here I place a fleece of wool on the threshing floor. If dew falls only on the fleece and all the ground remains dry, I shall know that You will deliver Israel through me, as You have said.”
content_old: 37 here I place a fleece of wool on the threshing floor. If dew falls only on the fleece and all the ground remains dry, I shall know that You will deliver Israel through me, as You have said.”

content: 38 And that is what happened. Early the next day, he squeezed the fleece and wrung out the dew from the fleece, a bowlful of water.
content_old: 38 And that is what happened. Early the next day, he squeezed the fleece and wrung out the dew from the fleece, a bowlful of water.

content: 39 Then Gideon said to God, “Do not be angry with me if I speak just once more. Let me make just one more test with the fleece: let the fleece alone be dry, while there is dew all over the ground.”
content_old: 39 Then Gideon said to God, “Do not be angry with me if I speak just once more. Let me make just one more test with the fleece: let the fleece alone be dry, while there is dew all over the ground.”

content: 1 Early next day, Jerubbaal—that is, Gideon—and all the troops with him encamped above En-harod, while the camp of Midian was in the plain to the north of him, at Gibeath-moreh.
content_old: 1 Early next day, Jerubbaal—that is, Gideon—and all the troops with him encamped above En-harod, while the camp of Midian was in the plain to the north of him, at Gibeath-moreh.

content: 2 The LORD said to Gideon, “You have too many troops with you for Me to deliver Midian into their hands; Israel might claim for themselves the glory due to Me, thinking, ‘Our own hand has brought us victory.’
content_old: 2 The LORD said to Gideon, “You have too many troops with you for Me to deliver Midian into their hands; Israel might claim for themselves the glory due to Me, thinking, ‘Our own hand has brought us victory.’

content: 3 Therefore, announce to the men, ‘Let anybody who is timid and fearful turn back, as a bird flies from Mount Gilead.’ ” Thereupon, 22,000 of the troops turned back and 10,000 remained.
content_old: 3 Therefore, announce to the men, ‘Let anybody who is timid and fearful turn back, as a bird flies from Mount Gilead.’ ” Thereupon, 22,000 of the troops turned back and 10,000 remained.

content: 4 “There are still too many troops,” the LORD said to Gideon. “Take them down to the water and I will sift them for you there. Anyone of whom I tell you, ‘This one is to go with you,’ that one shall go with you; and anyone of whom I tell you, ‘This one is not to go with you,’ that one shall not go.”
content_old: 4 “There are still too many troops,” the LORD said to Gideon. “Take them down to the water and I will sift them for you there. Anyone of whom I tell you, ‘This one is to go with you,’ that one shall go with you; and anyone of whom I tell you, ‘This one is not to go with you,’ that one shall not go.”

content: 5 So he took the troops down to the water. Then the LORD said to Gideon, “Set apart all those who lap up the water with their tongues like dogs from all those who get down on their knees to drink.”
content_old: 5 So he took the troops down to the water. Then the LORD said to Gideon, “Set apart all those who lap up the water with their tongues like dogs from all those who get down on their knees to drink.”

content: 6 Now those who “lapped” the water into their mouths by hand numbered three hundred; all the rest of the troops got down on their knees to drink.
content_old: 6 Now those who “lapped” the water into their mouths by hand numbered three hundred; all the rest of the troops got down on their knees to drink.

content: 7 Then the LORD said to Gideon, “I will deliver you and I will put Midian into your hands through the three hundred ‘lappers’; let the rest of the troops go home.”
content_old: 7 Then the LORD said to Gideon, “I will deliver you and I will put Midian into your hands through the three hundred ‘lappers’; let the rest of the troops go home.”

content: 8 So took the provisions and horns that the other men had with them, and he sent the rest of the men of Israel back to their homes, retaining only the three hundred men. The Midianite camp was below him, in the plain.
content_old: 8 So took the provisions and horns that the other men had with them, and he sent the rest of the men of Israel back to their homes, retaining only the three hundred men. The Midianite camp was below him, in the plain.

content: 9 That night the LORD said to him, “Come, attack the camp, for I have delivered it into your hands.
content_old: 9 That night the LORD said to him, “Come, attack the camp, for I have delivered it into your hands.

content: 10 And if you are afraid to attack, first go down to the camp with your attendant Purah
content_old: 10 And if you are afraid to attack, first go down to the camp with your attendant Purah

content: 11 and listen to what they say; after that you will have the courage to attack the camp.” So he went down with his attendant Purah to the outposts of the warriors who were in the camp.—
content_old: 11 and listen to what they say; after that you will have the courage to attack the camp.” So he went down with his attendant Purah to the outposts of the warriors who were in the camp.—

content: 12 Now Midian, Amalek, and all the Kedemites were spread over the plain, as thick as locusts; and their camels were countless, as numerous as the sands on the seashore.—
content_old: 12 Now Midian, Amalek, and all the Kedemites were spread over the plain, as thick as locusts; and their camels were countless, as numerous as the sands on the seashore.—

content: 13 Gideon came there just as one man was narrating a dream to another. “Listen,” he was saying, “I had this dream: There was a commotion—a loaf of barley bread was whirling through the Midianite camp. It came to a tent and struck it, and it fell; it turned it upside down, and the tent collapsed.”
content_old: 13 Gideon came there just as one man was narrating a dream to another. “Listen,” he was saying, “I had this dream: There was a commotion—a loaf of barley bread was whirling through the Midianite camp. It came to a tent and struck it, and it fell; it turned it upside down, and the tent collapsed.”

content: 14 To this the other responded, “That can only mean the sword of the Israelite Gideon son of Joash. God is delivering Midian and the entire camp into his hands.”
content_old: 14 To this the other responded, “That can only mean the sword of the Israelite Gideon son of Joash. God is delivering Midian and the entire camp into his hands.”

content: 15 When Gideon heard the dream told and interpreted, he bowed low. Returning to the camp of Israel, he shouted, “Come on! The LORD has delivered the Midianite camp into your hands!”
content_old: 15 When Gideon heard the dream told and interpreted, he bowed low. Returning to the camp of Israel, he shouted, “Come on! The LORD has delivered the Midianite camp into your hands!”

content: 16 He divided the three hundred men into three columns and equipped every man with a ram’s horn and an empty jar, with a torch in each jar.
content_old: 16 He divided the three hundred men into three columns and equipped every man with a ram’s horn and an empty jar, with a torch in each jar.

content: 17 “Watch me,” he said, “and do the same. When I get to the outposts of the camp, do exactly as I do.
content_old: 17 “Watch me,” he said, “and do the same. When I get to the outposts of the camp, do exactly as I do.

content: 18 When I and all those with me blow our horns, you too, all around the camp, will blow your horns and shout, ‘For the LORD and for Gideon!’ ”
content_old: 18 When I and all those with me blow our horns, you too, all around the camp, will blow your horns and shout, ‘For the LORD and for Gideon!’ ”

content: 19 Gideon and the hundred men with him arrived at the outposts of the camp, at the beginning of the middle watch, just after the sentries were posted. They sounded the horns and smashed the jars that they had with them,
content_old: 19 Gideon and the hundred men with him arrived at the outposts of the camp, at the beginning of the middle watch, just after the sentries were posted. They sounded the horns and smashed the jars that they had with them,

content: 20 and the three columns blew their horns and broke their jars. Holding the torches in their left hands and the horns for blowing in their right hands, they shouted, “A sword for the LORD and for Gideon!”
content_old: 20 and the three columns blew their horns and broke their jars. Holding the torches in their left hands and the horns for blowing in their right hands, they shouted, “A sword for the LORD and for Gideon!”

content: 21 They remained standing where they were, surrounding the camp; but the entire camp ran about yelling, and took to flight.
content_old: 21 They remained standing where they were, surrounding the camp; but the entire camp ran about yelling, and took to flight.

content: 22 For when the three hundred horns were sounded, the LORD turned every man’s sword against his fellow, throughout the camp, and the entire host fled as far as Beth-shittah and on to Zererah—as far as the outskirts of Abel-meholah near Tabbath.
content_old: 22 For when the three hundred horns were sounded, the LORD turned every man’s sword against his fellow, throughout the camp, and the entire host fled as far as Beth-shittah and on to Zererah—as far as the outskirts of Abel-meholah near Tabbath.

content: 23 And now the men of Israel from Naphtali and Asher and from all of Manasseh rallied for the pursuit of the Midianites.
content_old: 23 And now the men of Israel from Naphtali and Asher and from all of Manasseh rallied for the pursuit of the Midianites.

content: 24 Gideon also sent messengers all through the hill country of Ephraim with this order: “Go down ahead of the Midianites and seize their access to the water all along the Jordan down to Beth-barah.” So all the men of Ephraim rallied and seized the waterside down to Beth-barah by the Jordan.
content_old: 24 Gideon also sent messengers all through the hill country of Ephraim with this order: “Go down ahead of the Midianites and seize their access to the water all along the Jordan down to Beth-barah.” So all the men of Ephraim rallied and seized the waterside down to Beth-barah by the Jordan.

content: 1 And the men of Ephraim said to him, “Why did you do that to us—not calling us when you went to fight the Midianites?” And they rebuked him severely.
content_old: 1 And the men of Ephraim said to him, “Why did you do that to us—not calling us when you went to fight the Midianites?” And they rebuked him severely.

content: 2 But he answered them, “After all, what have I accomplished compared to you? Why, Ephraim’s gleanings are better than Abiezer’s vintage!
content_old: 2 But he answered them, “After all, what have I accomplished compared to you? Why, Ephraim’s gleanings are better than Abiezer’s vintage!

content: 3 God has delivered the Midianite generals Oreb and Zeeb into your hands, and what was I able to do compared to you?” And when he spoke in this fashion, their anger against him abated.
content_old: 3 God has delivered the Midianite generals Oreb and Zeeb into your hands, and what was I able to do compared to you?” And when he spoke in this fashion, their anger against him abated.

content: 4 Gideon came to the Jordan and crossed it. The three hundred men with him were famished, but still in pursuit.
content_old: 4 Gideon came to the Jordan and crossed it. The three hundred men with him were famished, but still in pursuit.

content: 5 He said to the people of Succoth, “Please give some loaves of bread to the men who are following me, for they are famished, and I am pursuing Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.”
content_old: 5 He said to the people of Succoth, “Please give some loaves of bread to the men who are following me, for they are famished, and I am pursuing Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.”

content: 6 But the officials of Succoth replied, “Are Zebah and Zalmunna already in your hands, that we should give bread to your troops?”
content_old: 6 But the officials of Succoth replied, “Are Zebah and Zalmunna already in your hands, that we should give bread to your troops?”

content: 7 “I swear,” declared Gideon, “when the LORD delivers Zebah and Zalmunna into my hands, I’ll thresh your bodies upon desert thorns and briers!”
content_old: 7 “I swear,” declared Gideon, “when the LORD delivers Zebah and Zalmunna into my hands, I’ll thresh your bodies upon desert thorns and briers!”

content: 8 From there he went up to Penuel and made the same request of them; but the people of Penuel gave him the same reply as the people of Succoth.
content_old: 8 From there he went up to Penuel and made the same request of them; but the people of Penuel gave him the same reply as the people of Succoth.

content: 9 So he also threatened the people of Penuel: “When I come back safe, I’ll tear down this tower!”
content_old: 9 So he also threatened the people of Penuel: “When I come back safe, I’ll tear down this tower!”

content: 10 Now Zebah and Zalmunna were at Karkor with their army of about 15,000; these were all that remained of the entire host of the Kedemites, for the slain numbered 120,000 fighting men.
content_old: 10 Now Zebah and Zalmunna were at Karkor with their army of about 15,000; these were all that remained of the entire host of the Kedemites, for the slain numbered 120,000 fighting men.

content: 11 Gideon marched up the road of the tent dwellers, up to east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and routed the camp, which was off guard.
content_old: 11 Gideon marched up the road of the tent dwellers, up to east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and routed the camp, which was off guard.

content: 12 Zebah and Zalmunna took to flight, with Gideon in pursuit. He captured Zebah and Zalmunna, the two kings of Midian, and threw the whole army into panic.
content_old: 12 Zebah and Zalmunna took to flight, with Gideon in pursuit. He captured Zebah and Zalmunna, the two kings of Midian, and threw the whole army into panic.

content: 13 On his way back from the battle at the Ascent of Heres, Gideon son of Joash
content_old: 13 On his way back from the battle at the Ascent of Heres, Gideon son of Joash

content: 14 captured a boy from among the people of Succoth and interrogated him. The latter drew up for him a list of the officials and elders of Succoth, seventy-seven in number.
content_old: 14 captured a boy from among the people of Succoth and interrogated him. The latter drew up for him a list of the officials and elders of Succoth, seventy-seven in number.

content: 15 Then he came to the people of Succoth and said, “Here are Zebah and Zalmunna, about whom you mocked me, saying, ‘Are Zebah and Zalmunna already in your hands, that we should give your famished men bread?’ ”
content_old: 15 Then he came to the people of Succoth and said, “Here are Zebah and Zalmunna, about whom you mocked me, saying, ‘Are Zebah and Zalmunna already in your hands, that we should give your famished men bread?’ ”

content: 16 And he took the elders of the city and, desert thorns and briers, he punished the people of Succoth with them.
content_old: 16 And he took the elders of the city and, desert thorns and briers, he punished the people of Succoth with them.

content: 17 As for Penuel, he tore down its tower and killed the townspeople.
content_old: 17 As for Penuel, he tore down its tower and killed the townspeople.

content: 18 Then he asked Zebah and Zalmunna, “Those men you killed at Tabor, what were they like?” “They looked just like you,” they replied, “like sons of a king.”
content_old: 18 Then he asked Zebah and Zalmunna, “Those men you killed at Tabor, what were they like?” “They looked just like you,” they replied, “like sons of a king.”

content: 19 “They were my brothers,” he declared, “the sons of my mother. As the LORD lives, if you had spared them, I would not kill you.”
content_old: 19 “They were my brothers,” he declared, “the sons of my mother. As the LORD lives, if you had spared them, I would not kill you.”

content: 20 And he commanded his oldest son Jether, “Go kill them!” But the boy did not draw his sword, for he was timid, being still a boy.
content_old: 20 And he commanded his oldest son Jether, “Go kill them!” But the boy did not draw his sword, for he was timid, being still a boy.

content: 21 Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, “Come, you slay us; for strength comes with manhood.” So Gideon went over and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the crescents that were on the necks of their camels.
content_old: 21 Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, “Come, you slay us; for strength comes with manhood.” So Gideon went over and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the crescents that were on the necks of their camels.

content: 22 Then the men of Israel said to Gideon, “Rule over us—you, your son, and your grandson as well; for you have saved us from the Midianites.”
content_old: 22 Then the men of Israel said to Gideon, “Rule over us—you, your son, and your grandson as well; for you have saved us from the Midianites.”

content: 23 But Gideon replied, “I will not rule over you myself, nor shall my son rule over you; the LORD alone shall rule over you.”
content_old: 23 But Gideon replied, “I will not rule over you myself, nor shall my son rule over you; the LORD alone shall rule over you.”

content: 24 And Gideon said to them, “I have a request to make of you: Each of you give me the earring he received as booty.” They had golden earrings, for they were Ishmaelites.
content_old: 24 And Gideon said to them, “I have a request to make of you: Each of you give me the earring he received as booty.” They had golden earrings, for they were Ishmaelites.

content: 25 “Certainly!” they replied. And they spread out a cloth, and everyone threw onto it the earring he had received as booty.
content_old: 25 “Certainly!” they replied. And they spread out a cloth, and everyone threw onto it the earring he had received as booty.

content: 26 The weight of the golden earrings that he had requested came to 1,700 shekels of gold; this was in addition to the crescents and the pendants and the purple robes worn by the kings of Midian and in addition to the collars on the necks of their camels.
content_old: 26 The weight of the golden earrings that he had requested came to 1,700 shekels of gold; this was in addition to the crescents and the pendants and the purple robes worn by the kings of Midian and in addition to the collars on the necks of their camels.

content: 27 Gideon made an ephod of this gold and set it up in his own town of Ophrah. There all Israel went astray after it, and it became a snare to Gideon and his household.
content_old: 27 Gideon made an ephod of this gold and set it up in his own town of Ophrah. There all Israel went astray after it, and it became a snare to Gideon and his household.

content: 28 Thus Midian submitted to the Israelites and did not raise its head again; and the land was tranquil for forty years in Gideon’s time.
content_old: 28 Thus Midian submitted to the Israelites and did not raise its head again; and the land was tranquil for forty years in Gideon’s time.

content: 29 So Jerubbaal son of Joash retired to his own house.
content_old: 29 So Jerubbaal son of Joash retired to his own house.

content: 30 Gideon had seventy sons of his own issue, for he had many wives.
content_old: 30 Gideon had seventy sons of his own issue, for he had many wives.

content: 31 A son was also born to him by his concubine in Shechem, and he named him Abimelech.
content_old: 31 A son was also born to him by his concubine in Shechem, and he named him Abimelech.

content: 32 Gideon son of Joash died at a ripe old age, and was buried in the tomb of his father Joash at Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
content_old: 32 Gideon son of Joash died at a ripe old age, and was buried in the tomb of his father Joash at Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

content: 33 After Gideon died, the Israelites again went astray after the Baalim, and they adopted Baal-berith as a god.
content_old: 33 After Gideon died, the Israelites again went astray after the Baalim, and they adopted Baal-berith as a god.

content: 34 The Israelites gave no thought to the LORD their God, who saved them from all the enemies around them.
content_old: 34 The Israelites gave no thought to the LORD their God, who saved them from all the enemies around them.

content: 1 Abimelech son of Jerubbaal went to his mother’s brothers in Shechem and spoke to them and to the whole clan of his mother’s family. He said,
content_old: 1 Abimelech son of Jerubbaal went to his mother’s brothers in Shechem and spoke to them and to the whole clan of his mother’s family. He said,

content: 2 “Put this question to all the citizens of Shechem: Which is better for you, to be ruled by seventy men—by all the sons of Jerubbaal—or to be ruled by one man? And remember, I am your own flesh and blood.”
content_old: 2 “Put this question to all the citizens of Shechem: Which is better for you, to be ruled by seventy men—by all the sons of Jerubbaal—or to be ruled by one man? And remember, I am your own flesh and blood.”

content: 3 His mother’s brothers said all this in his behalf to all the citizens of Shechem, and they were won over to Abimelech; for they thought, “He is our kinsman.”
content_old: 3 His mother’s brothers said all this in his behalf to all the citizens of Shechem, and they were won over to Abimelech; for they thought, “He is our kinsman.”

content: 4 They gave him seventy shekels from the temple of Baal-berith; and with this Abimelech hired some worthless and reckless fellows, and they followed him.
content_old: 4 They gave him seventy shekels from the temple of Baal-berith; and with this Abimelech hired some worthless and reckless fellows, and they followed him.

content: 5 Then he went to his father’s house in Ophrah and killed his brothers, the sons of Jerubbaal, seventy men on one stone. Only Jotham, the youngest son of Jerubbaal, survived, because he went into hiding.
content_old: 5 Then he went to his father’s house in Ophrah and killed his brothers, the sons of Jerubbaal, seventy men on one stone. Only Jotham, the youngest son of Jerubbaal, survived, because he went into hiding.

content: 6 All the citizens of Shechem and all Beth-millo convened, and they proclaimed Abimelech king at the terebinth of the pillar at Shechem.
content_old: 6 All the citizens of Shechem and all Beth-millo convened, and they proclaimed Abimelech king at the terebinth of the pillar at Shechem.

content: 7 When Jotham was informed, he went and stood on top of Mount Gerizim and called out to them in a loud voice. “Citizens of Shechem!” he cried, “listen to me, that God may listen to you.
content_old: 7 When Jotham was informed, he went and stood on top of Mount Gerizim and called out to them in a loud voice. “Citizens of Shechem!” he cried, “listen to me, that God may listen to you.

content: 8 “Once the trees went to anoint a king over themselves. They said to the olive tree, ‘Reign over us.’
content_old: 8 “Once the trees went to anoint a king over themselves. They said to the olive tree, ‘Reign over us.’

content: 9 But the olive tree replied, ‘Have I, through whom God and men are honored, stopped yielding my rich oil, that I should go and wave above the trees?’
content_old: 9 But the olive tree replied, ‘Have I, through whom God and men are honored, stopped yielding my rich oil, that I should go and wave above the trees?’

content: 10 So the trees said to the fig tree, ‘You come and reign over us.’
content_old: 10 So the trees said to the fig tree, ‘You come and reign over us.’

content: 11 But the fig tree replied, ‘Have I stopped yielding my sweetness, my delicious fruit, that I should go and wave above the trees?’
content_old: 11 But the fig tree replied, ‘Have I stopped yielding my sweetness, my delicious fruit, that I should go and wave above the trees?’

content: 12 So the trees said to the vine, ‘You come and reign over us.’
content_old: 12 So the trees said to the vine, ‘You come and reign over us.’

content: 13 But the vine replied, ‘Have I stopped yielding my new wine, which gladdens God and men, that I should go and wave above the trees?’
content_old: 13 But the vine replied, ‘Have I stopped yielding my new wine, which gladdens God and men, that I should go and wave above the trees?’

content: 14 Then all the trees said to the thornbush, ‘You come and reign over us.’
content_old: 14 Then all the trees said to the thornbush, ‘You come and reign over us.’

content: 15 And the thornbush said to the trees, ‘If you are acting honorably in anointing me king over you, come and take shelter in my shade; but if not, may fire issue from the thornbush and consume the cedars of Lebanon!’
content_old: 15 And the thornbush said to the trees, ‘If you are acting honorably in anointing me king over you, come and take shelter in my shade; but if not, may fire issue from the thornbush and consume the cedars of Lebanon!’

content: 16 “Now then, if you acted honorably and loyally in making Abimelech king, if you have done right by Jerubbaal and his house and have requited him according to his deserts—
content_old: 16 “Now then, if you acted honorably and loyally in making Abimelech king, if you have done right by Jerubbaal and his house and have requited him according to his deserts—

content: 17 considering that my father fought for you and saved you from the Midianites at the risk of his life,
content_old: 17 considering that my father fought for you and saved you from the Midianites at the risk of his life,
