content: 18 and now you have turned on my father’s household, killed his sons, seventy men on one stone, and set up Abimelech, the son of his handmaid, as king over the citizens of Shechem just because he is your kinsman—
content_old: 18 and now you have turned on my father’s household, killed his sons, seventy men on one stone, and set up Abimelech, the son of his handmaid, as king over the citizens of Shechem just because he is your kinsman—

content: 19 if, I say, you have this day acted honorably and loyally toward Jerubbaal and his house, have joy in Abimelech and may he likewise have joy in you.
content_old: 19 if, I say, you have this day acted honorably and loyally toward Jerubbaal and his house, have joy in Abimelech and may he likewise have joy in you.

content: 20 But if not, may fire issue from Abimelech and consume the citizens of Shechem and Beth-millo, and may fire issue from the citizens of Shechem and Beth-millo and consume Abimelech!”
content_old: 20 But if not, may fire issue from Abimelech and consume the citizens of Shechem and Beth-millo, and may fire issue from the citizens of Shechem and Beth-millo and consume Abimelech!”

content: 21 With that, Jotham fled. He ran to Beer and stayed there, because of his brother Abimelech.
content_old: 21 With that, Jotham fled. He ran to Beer and stayed there, because of his brother Abimelech.

content: 22 Abimelech held sway over Israel for three years.
content_old: 22 Abimelech held sway over Israel for three years.

content: 23 Then God sent a spirit of discord between Abimelech and the citizens of Shechem, and the citizens of Shechem broke faith with Abimelech—
content_old: 23 Then God sent a spirit of discord between Abimelech and the citizens of Shechem, and the citizens of Shechem broke faith with Abimelech—

content: 24 to the end that the crime committed against the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might be avenged, and their blood recoil upon their brother Abimelech, who had slain them, and upon the citizens of Shechem, who had abetted him in the slaying of his brothers.
content_old: 24 to the end that the crime committed against the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might be avenged, and their blood recoil upon their brother Abimelech, who had slain them, and upon the citizens of Shechem, who had abetted him in the slaying of his brothers.

content: 25 The citizens of Shechem planted ambuscades against him on the hilltops; and they robbed whoever passed by them on the road. Word of this reached Abimelech.
content_old: 25 The citizens of Shechem planted ambuscades against him on the hilltops; and they robbed whoever passed by them on the road. Word of this reached Abimelech.

content: 26 Then Gaal son of Ebed and his companions came passing through Shechem, and the citizens of Shechem gave him their confidence.
content_old: 26 Then Gaal son of Ebed and his companions came passing through Shechem, and the citizens of Shechem gave him their confidence.

content: 27 They went out into the fields, gathered and trod out the vintage of their vineyards, and made a festival. They entered the temple of their god, and as they ate and drank they reviled Abimelech.
content_old: 27 They went out into the fields, gathered and trod out the vintage of their vineyards, and made a festival. They entered the temple of their god, and as they ate and drank they reviled Abimelech.

content: 28 Gaal son of Ebed said, “Who is Abimelech and who are we Shechemites, that we should serve him? This same son of Jerubbaal and his lieutenant Zebul once served the men of Hamor, the father of Shechem; so why should we serve him?
content_old: 28 Gaal son of Ebed said, “Who is Abimelech and who are we Shechemites, that we should serve him? This same son of Jerubbaal and his lieutenant Zebul once served the men of Hamor, the father of Shechem; so why should we serve him?

content: 29 Oh, if only this people were under my command, I would get rid of Abimelech! One would challenge Abimelech, ‘Fill up your ranks and come out here!’ ”
content_old: 29 Oh, if only this people were under my command, I would get rid of Abimelech! One would challenge Abimelech, ‘Fill up your ranks and come out here!’ ”

content: 30 When Zebul, the governor of the city, heard the words of Gaal son of Ebed, he was furious.
content_old: 30 When Zebul, the governor of the city, heard the words of Gaal son of Ebed, he was furious.

content: 31 He sent messages to Abimelech at Tormah to say, “Gaal son of Ebed and his companions have come to Shechem and they are inciting the city against you.
content_old: 31 He sent messages to Abimelech at Tormah to say, “Gaal son of Ebed and his companions have come to Shechem and they are inciting the city against you.

content: 32 Therefore, set out at night with the forces you have with you and conceal yourself in the fields.
content_old: 32 Therefore, set out at night with the forces you have with you and conceal yourself in the fields.

content: 33 Early next morning, as the sun rises, advance on the city. He and his men will thereupon come out against you, and you will do to him whatever you find possible.”
content_old: 33 Early next morning, as the sun rises, advance on the city. He and his men will thereupon come out against you, and you will do to him whatever you find possible.”

content: 34 Abimelech and all the men with him set out at night and disposed themselves against Shechem in four hiding places.
content_old: 34 Abimelech and all the men with him set out at night and disposed themselves against Shechem in four hiding places.

content: 35 When Gaal son of Ebed came out and stood at the entrance to the city gate, Abimelech and the army with him emerged from concealment.
content_old: 35 When Gaal son of Ebed came out and stood at the entrance to the city gate, Abimelech and the army with him emerged from concealment.

content: 36 Gaal saw the army and said to Zebul, “That’s an army marching down from the hilltops!” But Zebul said to him, “The shadows of the hills look to you like men.”
content_old: 36 Gaal saw the army and said to Zebul, “That’s an army marching down from the hilltops!” But Zebul said to him, “The shadows of the hills look to you like men.”

content: 37 Gaal spoke up again, “Look, an army is marching down from Tabbur-erez, and another column is coming from the direction of Elon-meonenim.”
content_old: 37 Gaal spoke up again, “Look, an army is marching down from Tabbur-erez, and another column is coming from the direction of Elon-meonenim.”

content: 38 “Well,” replied Zebul, “where is your boast, ‘Who is Abimelech that we should serve him’? There is the army you sneered at; now go out and fight it!”
content_old: 38 “Well,” replied Zebul, “where is your boast, ‘Who is Abimelech that we should serve him’? There is the army you sneered at; now go out and fight it!”

content: 39 So Gaal went out at the head of the citizens of Shechem and gave battle to Abimelech.
content_old: 39 So Gaal went out at the head of the citizens of Shechem and gave battle to Abimelech.

content: 40 But he had to flee before him, and Abimelech pursued him, and many fell slain, all the way to the entrance of the gate.
content_old: 40 But he had to flee before him, and Abimelech pursued him, and many fell slain, all the way to the entrance of the gate.

content: 41 Then Abimelech stayed in Arumah, while Zebul expelled Gaal and his companions and kept them out of Shechem.
content_old: 41 Then Abimelech stayed in Arumah, while Zebul expelled Gaal and his companions and kept them out of Shechem.

content: 42 The next day, when people went out into the fields, Abimelech was informed.
content_old: 42 The next day, when people went out into the fields, Abimelech was informed.

content: 43 Taking the army, he divided it into three columns and lay in ambush in the fields; and when he saw the people coming out of the city, he pounced upon them and struck them down.
content_old: 43 Taking the army, he divided it into three columns and lay in ambush in the fields; and when he saw the people coming out of the city, he pounced upon them and struck them down.

content: 44 While Abimelech and the column that followed him dashed ahead and took up a position at the entrance of the city gate, the other two columns rushed upon all that were in the open and struck them down.
content_old: 44 While Abimelech and the column that followed him dashed ahead and took up a position at the entrance of the city gate, the other two columns rushed upon all that were in the open and struck them down.

content: 45 Abimelech fought against the city all that day. He captured the city and massacred the people in it; he razed the town and sowed it with salt.
content_old: 45 Abimelech fought against the city all that day. He captured the city and massacred the people in it; he razed the town and sowed it with salt.

content: 46 When all the citizens of the Tower of Shechem learned of this, they went into the tunnel of the temple of El-berith.
content_old: 46 When all the citizens of the Tower of Shechem learned of this, they went into the tunnel of the temple of El-berith.

content: 47 When Abimelech was informed that all the citizens of the Tower of Shechem had gathered
content_old: 47 When Abimelech was informed that all the citizens of the Tower of Shechem had gathered

content: 48 Abimelech and all the troops he had with him went up on Mount Zalmon. Taking an ax in his hand, Abimelech lopped off a tree limb and lifted it onto his shoulder. Then he said to the troops that accompanied him, “What you saw me do—quick, do the same!”
content_old: 48 Abimelech and all the troops he had with him went up on Mount Zalmon. Taking an ax in his hand, Abimelech lopped off a tree limb and lifted it onto his shoulder. Then he said to the troops that accompanied him, “What you saw me do—quick, do the same!”

content: 49 So each of the troops also lopped off a bough; then they marched behind Abimelech and laid them against the tunnel, and set fire to the tunnel over their heads. Thus all the people of the Tower of Shechem also perished, about a thousand men and women.
content_old: 49 So each of the troops also lopped off a bough; then they marched behind Abimelech and laid them against the tunnel, and set fire to the tunnel over their heads. Thus all the people of the Tower of Shechem also perished, about a thousand men and women.

content: 50 Abimelech proceeded to Thebez; he encamped at Thebez and occupied it.
content_old: 50 Abimelech proceeded to Thebez; he encamped at Thebez and occupied it.

content: 51 Within the town was a fortified tower; and all the citizens of the town, men and women, took refuge there. They shut themselves in, and went up on the roof of the tower.
content_old: 51 Within the town was a fortified tower; and all the citizens of the town, men and women, took refuge there. They shut themselves in, and went up on the roof of the tower.

content: 52 Abimelech pressed forward to the tower and attacked it. He approached the door of the tower to set it on fire.
content_old: 52 Abimelech pressed forward to the tower and attacked it. He approached the door of the tower to set it on fire.

content: 53 But a woman dropped an upper millstone on Abimelech’s head and cracked his skull.
content_old: 53 But a woman dropped an upper millstone on Abimelech’s head and cracked his skull.

content: 54 He immediately cried out to his attendant, his arms-bearer, “Draw your dagger and finish me off, that they may not say of me, ‘A woman killed him!’ ” So his attendant stabbed him, and he died.
content_old: 54 He immediately cried out to his attendant, his arms-bearer, “Draw your dagger and finish me off, that they may not say of me, ‘A woman killed him!’ ” So his attendant stabbed him, and he died.

content: 55 When the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, everyone went home.
content_old: 55 When the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, everyone went home.

content: 56 Thus God repaid Abimelech for the evil he had done to his father by slaying his seventy brothers;
content_old: 56 Thus God repaid Abimelech for the evil he had done to his father by slaying his seventy brothers;

content: 1 After Abimelech, Tola son of Puah son of Dodo, a man of Issachar, arose to deliver Israel. He lived at Shamir in the hill country of Ephraim.
content_old: 1 After Abimelech, Tola son of Puah son of Dodo, a man of Issachar, arose to deliver Israel. He lived at Shamir in the hill country of Ephraim.

content: 2 He led Israel for twenty-three years; then he died and was buried at Shamir.
content_old: 2 He led Israel for twenty-three years; then he died and was buried at Shamir.

content: 3 After him arose Jair the Gileadite, and he led Israel for twenty-two years.
content_old: 3 After him arose Jair the Gileadite, and he led Israel for twenty-two years.

content: 4 He had thirty sons, who rode on thirty burros and owned thirty boroughs in the region of Gilead; these are called Havvoth-jair to this day.
content_old: 4 He had thirty sons, who rode on thirty burros and owned thirty boroughs in the region of Gilead; these are called Havvoth-jair to this day.

content: 5 Then Jair died and was buried at Kamon.
content_old: 5 Then Jair died and was buried at Kamon.

content: 6 The Israelites again did what was offensive to the LORD. They served the Baalim and the Ashtaroth, and the gods of Aram, the gods of Sidon, the gods of Moab, the gods of the Ammonites, and the gods of the Philistines; they forsook the LORD and did not serve Him.
content_old: 6 The Israelites again did what was offensive to the LORD. They served the Baalim and the Ashtaroth, and the gods of Aram, the gods of Sidon, the gods of Moab, the gods of the Ammonites, and the gods of the Philistines; they forsook the LORD and did not serve Him.

content: 7 And the LORD, incensed with Israel, surrendered them to the Philistines and to the Ammonites.
content_old: 7 And the LORD, incensed with Israel, surrendered them to the Philistines and to the Ammonites.

content: 8 That year they battered and shattered the Israelites—for eighteen years��all the Israelites beyond the Jordan, inwhat had been the land of the Amorites in Gilead.
content_old: 8 That year they battered and shattered the Israelites—for eighteen years��all the Israelites beyond the Jordan, inwhat had been the land of the Amorites in Gilead.

content: 9 The Ammonites also crossed the Jordan to make war on Judah, Benjamin, and the House of Ephraim. Israel was in great distress.
content_old: 9 The Ammonites also crossed the Jordan to make war on Judah, Benjamin, and the House of Ephraim. Israel was in great distress.

content: 10 Then the Israelites cried out to the LORD, “We stand guilty before You, for we have forsaken our God and served the Baalim.”
content_old: 10 Then the Israelites cried out to the LORD, “We stand guilty before You, for we have forsaken our God and served the Baalim.”

content: 11 But the LORD said to the Israelites, “I have rescued you from the Egyptians, from the Amorites, from the Ammonites, and from the Philistines.
content_old: 11 But the LORD said to the Israelites, “I have rescued you from the Egyptians, from the Amorites, from the Ammonites, and from the Philistines.

content: 12 The Sidonians, Amalek, and Maon also oppressed you; and when you cried out to Me, I saved you from them.
content_old: 12 The Sidonians, Amalek, and Maon also oppressed you; and when you cried out to Me, I saved you from them.

content: 13 Yet you have forsaken Me and have served other gods. No, I will not deliver you again.
content_old: 13 Yet you have forsaken Me and have served other gods. No, I will not deliver you again.

content: 14 Go cry to the gods you have chosen; let them deliver you in your time of distress!”
content_old: 14 Go cry to the gods you have chosen; let them deliver you in your time of distress!”

content: 15 But the Israelites implored the LORD: “We stand guilty. Do to us as You see fit; only save us this day!”
content_old: 15 But the Israelites implored the LORD: “We stand guilty. Do to us as You see fit; only save us this day!”

content: 16 They removed the alien gods from among them and served the LORD; and He could not bear the miseries of Israel.
content_old: 16 They removed the alien gods from among them and served the LORD; and He could not bear the miseries of Israel.

content: 17 The Ammonites mustered and they encamped in Gilead; and the Israelites massed and they encamped at Mizpah.
content_old: 17 The Ammonites mustered and they encamped in Gilead; and the Israelites massed and they encamped at Mizpah.

content: 1 Jephthah the Gileadite was an able warrior, who was the son of a prostitute. Jephthah’s father was Gilead;
content_old: 1 Jephthah the Gileadite was an able warrior, who was the son of a prostitute. Jephthah’s father was Gilead;

content: 2 but Gilead also had sons by his wife, and when the wife’s sons grew up, they drove Jephthah out. They said to him, “You shall have no share in our father’s property, for you are the son of an outsider.”
content_old: 2 but Gilead also had sons by his wife, and when the wife’s sons grew up, they drove Jephthah out. They said to him, “You shall have no share in our father’s property, for you are the son of an outsider.”

content: 3 So Jephthah fled from his brothers and settled in the Tob country. Men of low character gathered about Jephthah and went out raiding with him.
content_old: 3 So Jephthah fled from his brothers and settled in the Tob country. Men of low character gathered about Jephthah and went out raiding with him.

content: 4 Some time later, the Ammonites went to war against Israel.
content_old: 4 Some time later, the Ammonites went to war against Israel.

content: 5 And when the Ammonites attacked Israel, the elders of Gilead went to bring Jephthah back from the Tob country.
content_old: 5 And when the Ammonites attacked Israel, the elders of Gilead went to bring Jephthah back from the Tob country.

content: 6 They said to Jephthah, “Come be our chief, so that we can fight the Ammonites.”
content_old: 6 They said to Jephthah, “Come be our chief, so that we can fight the Ammonites.”

content: 7 Jephthah replied to the elders of Gilead, “You are the very people who rejected me and drove me out of my father’s house. How can you come to me now when you are in trouble?”
content_old: 7 Jephthah replied to the elders of Gilead, “You are the very people who rejected me and drove me out of my father’s house. How can you come to me now when you are in trouble?”

content: 8 The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “Honestly, we have now turned back to you. If you come with us and fight the Ammonites, you shall be our commander over all the inhabitants of Gilead.”
content_old: 8 The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “Honestly, we have now turned back to you. If you come with us and fight the Ammonites, you shall be our commander over all the inhabitants of Gilead.”

content: 9 Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, “if you bring me back to fight the Ammonites and the LORD delivers them to me, I am to be your commander.”
content_old: 9 Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, “if you bring me back to fight the Ammonites and the LORD delivers them to me, I am to be your commander.”

content: 10 And the elders of Gilead answered Jepthah, “The LORD Himself shall be witness between us: we will do just as you have said.”
content_old: 10 And the elders of Gilead answered Jepthah, “The LORD Himself shall be witness between us: we will do just as you have said.”

content: 11 Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him their commander and chief. And Jephthah repeated all these terms before the LORD at Mizpah.
content_old: 11 Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him their commander and chief. And Jephthah repeated all these terms before the LORD at Mizpah.

content: 12 Jephthah then sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites, saying, “What have you against me that you have come to make war on my country?”
content_old: 12 Jephthah then sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites, saying, “What have you against me that you have come to make war on my country?”

content: 13 The king of the Ammonites replied to Jephthah’s messengers, “When Israel came from Egypt, they seized the land which is mine, from the Arnon to the Jabbok as far as the Jordan. Now, then, restore it peaceably.”
content_old: 13 The king of the Ammonites replied to Jephthah’s messengers, “When Israel came from Egypt, they seized the land which is mine, from the Arnon to the Jabbok as far as the Jordan. Now, then, restore it peaceably.”

content: 14 Jephthah again sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites.
content_old: 14 Jephthah again sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites.

content: 15 He said to him, “Thus said Jephthah: Israel did not seize the land of Moab or the land of the Ammonites.
content_old: 15 He said to him, “Thus said Jephthah: Israel did not seize the land of Moab or the land of the Ammonites.

content: 16 When they left Egypt, Israel traveled through the wilderness to the Sea of Reeds and went on to Kadesh.
content_old: 16 When they left Egypt, Israel traveled through the wilderness to the Sea of Reeds and went on to Kadesh.

content: 17 Israel then sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, ‘Allow us to cross your country.’ But the king of Edom would not consent. They also sent a mission to the king of Moab, and he refused. So Israel, after staying at Kadesh,
content_old: 17 Israel then sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, ‘Allow us to cross your country.’ But the king of Edom would not consent. They also sent a mission to the king of Moab, and he refused. So Israel, after staying at Kadesh,

content: 18 traveled on through the wilderness, skirting the land of Edom and the land of Moab. They kept to the east of the land of Moab until they encamped on the other side of the Arnon; and, since Moab ends at the Arnon, they never entered Moabite territory.
content_old: 18 traveled on through the wilderness, skirting the land of Edom and the land of Moab. They kept to the east of the land of Moab until they encamped on the other side of the Arnon; and, since Moab ends at the Arnon, they never entered Moabite territory.

content: 19 “Then Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon. Israel said to him, ‘Allow us to cross through your country to our homeland.’
content_old: 19 “Then Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon. Israel said to him, ‘Allow us to cross through your country to our homeland.’

content: 20 But Sihon would not trust Israel to pass through his territory. Sihon mustered all his troops, and they encamped at Jahaz; he engaged Israel in battle.
content_old: 20 But Sihon would not trust Israel to pass through his territory. Sihon mustered all his troops, and they encamped at Jahaz; he engaged Israel in battle.

content: 21 But the LORD, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his troops into Israel’s hands, and they defeated them; and Israel took possession of all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that land.
content_old: 21 But the LORD, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his troops into Israel’s hands, and they defeated them; and Israel took possession of all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that land.

content: 22 Thus they possessed all the territory of the Amorites from the Arnon to the Jabbok and from the wilderness to the Jordan.
content_old: 22 Thus they possessed all the territory of the Amorites from the Arnon to the Jabbok and from the wilderness to the Jordan.

content: 23 “Now, then, the LORD, the God of Israel, dispossessed the Amorites before His people Israel; and should you possess their land?
content_old: 23 “Now, then, the LORD, the God of Israel, dispossessed the Amorites before His people Israel; and should you possess their land?

content: 24 Do you not hold what Chemosh your god gives you to possess? So we will hold on to everything that the LORD our God has given us to possess.
content_old: 24 Do you not hold what Chemosh your god gives you to possess? So we will hold on to everything that the LORD our God has given us to possess.

content: 25 “Besides, are you any better than Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he start a quarrel with Israel or go to war with them?
content_old: 25 “Besides, are you any better than Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he start a quarrel with Israel or go to war with them?

content: 26 “While Israel has been inhabiting Heshbon and its dependencies, and Aroer and its dependencies, and all the towns along the Arnon for three hundred years, why have you not tried to recover them all this time?
content_old: 26 “While Israel has been inhabiting Heshbon and its dependencies, and Aroer and its dependencies, and all the towns along the Arnon for three hundred years, why have you not tried to recover them all this time?

content: 27 I have done you no wrong; yet you are doing me harm and making war on me. May the LORD, who judges, decide today between the Israelites and the Ammonites!”
content_old: 27 I have done you no wrong; yet you are doing me harm and making war on me. May the LORD, who judges, decide today between the Israelites and the Ammonites!”

content: 28 But the king of the Ammonites paid no heed to the message that Jephthah sent him.
content_old: 28 But the king of the Ammonites paid no heed to the message that Jephthah sent him.

content: 29 Then the spirit of the LORD came upon Jephthah. He marched through Gilead and Manasseh, passing Mizpeh of Gilead; and from Mizpeh of Gilead he crossed over to the Ammonites.
content_old: 29 Then the spirit of the LORD came upon Jephthah. He marched through Gilead and Manasseh, passing Mizpeh of Gilead; and from Mizpeh of Gilead he crossed over to the Ammonites.

content: 30 And Jephthah made the following vow to the LORD: “If you deliver the Ammonites into my hands,
content_old: 30 And Jephthah made the following vow to the LORD: “If you deliver the Ammonites into my hands,

content: 31 then whatever comes out of the door of my house to meet me on my safe return from the Ammonites shall be the LORD’s and shall be offered by me as a burnt offering.”
content_old: 31 then whatever comes out of the door of my house to meet me on my safe return from the Ammonites shall be the LORD’s and shall be offered by me as a burnt offering.”

content: 32 Jephthah crossed over to the Ammonites and attacked them, and the LORD delivered them into his hands.
content_old: 32 Jephthah crossed over to the Ammonites and attacked them, and the LORD delivered them into his hands.

content: 33 He utterly routed them—from Aroer as far as Minnith, twenty towns—all the way to Abel-cheramim. So the Ammonites submitted to the Israelites.
content_old: 33 He utterly routed them—from Aroer as far as Minnith, twenty towns—all the way to Abel-cheramim. So the Ammonites submitted to the Israelites.

content: 34 When Jephthah arrived at his home in Mizpah, there was his daughter coming out to meet him, with timbrel and dance! She was an only child; he had no other son or daughter.
content_old: 34 When Jephthah arrived at his home in Mizpah, there was his daughter coming out to meet him, with timbrel and dance! She was an only child; he had no other son or daughter.

content: 35 On seeing her, he rent his clothes and said, “Alas, daughter! You have brought me low; you have become my troubler! For I have uttered a vow to the LORD and I cannot retract.”
content_old: 35 On seeing her, he rent his clothes and said, “Alas, daughter! You have brought me low; you have become my troubler! For I have uttered a vow to the LORD and I cannot retract.”

content: 36 “Father,” she said, “you have uttered a vow to the LORD; do to me as you have vowed, seeing that the LORD has vindicated you against your enemies, the Ammonites.”
content_old: 36 “Father,” she said, “you have uttered a vow to the LORD; do to me as you have vowed, seeing that the LORD has vindicated you against your enemies, the Ammonites.”

content: 37 She further said to her father, “Let this be done for me: let me be for two months, and I will go with my companions and lament upon the hills and there bewail my maidenhood.”
content_old: 37 She further said to her father, “Let this be done for me: let me be for two months, and I will go with my companions and lament upon the hills and there bewail my maidenhood.”

content: 38 “Go,” he replied. He let her go for two months, and she and her companions went and bewailed her maidenhood upon the hills.
content_old: 38 “Go,” he replied. He let her go for two months, and she and her companions went and bewailed her maidenhood upon the hills.

content: 39 After two months’ time, she returned to her father, and he did to her as he had vowed. She had never known a man. So it became a custom in Israel
content_old: 39 After two months’ time, she returned to her father, and he did to her as he had vowed. She had never known a man. So it became a custom in Israel

content: 1 The men of Ephraim mustered and crossed to Zaphon. They said to Jephthah, “Why did you march to fight the Ammonites without calling us to go with you? We’ll burn your house down over you!”
content_old: 1 The men of Ephraim mustered and crossed to Zaphon. They said to Jephthah, “Why did you march to fight the Ammonites without calling us to go with you? We’ll burn your house down over you!”

content: 2 Jephthah answered them, “I and my people were in a bitter conflict with the Ammonites; and I summoned you, but you did not save me from them.
content_old: 2 Jephthah answered them, “I and my people were in a bitter conflict with the Ammonites; and I summoned you, but you did not save me from them.

content: 3 When I saw that you were no saviors, I risked my life and advanced against the Ammonites; and the LORD delivered them into my hands. Why have you come here now to fight against me?”
content_old: 3 When I saw that you were no saviors, I risked my life and advanced against the Ammonites; and the LORD delivered them into my hands. Why have you come here now to fight against me?”

content: 4 And Jephthah gathered all the men of Gilead and fought the Ephraimites. The men of Gilead defeated the Ephraimites; for they had said, “You Gileadites are nothing but fugitives from Ephraim—being in Manasseh is like being in Ephraim.”
content_old: 4 And Jephthah gathered all the men of Gilead and fought the Ephraimites. The men of Gilead defeated the Ephraimites; for they had said, “You Gileadites are nothing but fugitives from Ephraim—being in Manasseh is like being in Ephraim.”

content: 5 The Gileadites held the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites. And when any fugitive from Ephraim said, “Let me cross,” the men of Gilead would ask him, “Are you an Ephraimite?”; if he said “No,”
content_old: 5 The Gileadites held the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites. And when any fugitive from Ephraim said, “Let me cross,” the men of Gilead would ask him, “Are you an Ephraimite?”; if he said “No,”

content: 6 they would say to him, “Then say shibboleth“; but he would say “sibboleth,” not being able to pronounce it correctly. Thereupon they would seize him and slay him by the fords of the Jordan. Forty-two thousand Ephraimites fell at that time.
content_old: 6 they would say to him, “Then say shibboleth“; but he would say “sibboleth,” not being able to pronounce it correctly. Thereupon they would seize him and slay him by the fords of the Jordan. Forty-two thousand Ephraimites fell at that time.

content: 7 Jephthah led Israel six years. Then Jephthah the Gileadite died and he was buried in one of the towns of Gilead.
content_old: 7 Jephthah led Israel six years. Then Jephthah the Gileadite died and he was buried in one of the towns of Gilead.

content: 8 After him, Ibzan of Bethlehem led Israel.
content_old: 8 After him, Ibzan of Bethlehem led Israel.

content: 9 He had thirty sons, and he married off thirty daughters outside the clan and brought in thirty girls from outside the clan for his sons. He led Israel seven years.
content_old: 9 He had thirty sons, and he married off thirty daughters outside the clan and brought in thirty girls from outside the clan for his sons. He led Israel seven years.

content: 10 Then Ibzan died and was buried in Bethlehem.
content_old: 10 Then Ibzan died and was buried in Bethlehem.

content: 11 After him, Elon the Zebulunite led Israel; he led Israel for ten years.
content_old: 11 After him, Elon the Zebulunite led Israel; he led Israel for ten years.

content: 12 Then Elon the Zebulunite died and was buried in Aijalon, in the territory of Zebulun.
content_old: 12 Then Elon the Zebulunite died and was buried in Aijalon, in the territory of Zebulun.

content: 13 After him, Abdon son of Hillel the Pirathonite led Israel.
content_old: 13 After him, Abdon son of Hillel the Pirathonite led Israel.

content: 14 He had forty sons and thirty grandsons, who rode on seventy jackasses. He led Israel for eight years.
content_old: 14 He had forty sons and thirty grandsons, who rode on seventy jackasses. He led Israel for eight years.

content: 1 The Israelites again did what was offensive to the LORD, and the LORD delivered them into the hands of the Philistines for forty years.
content_old: 1 The Israelites again did what was offensive to the LORD, and the LORD delivered them into the hands of the Philistines for forty years.

content: 2 There was a certain man from Zorah, of the stock of Dan, whose name was Manoah. His wife was barren and had borne no children.
content_old: 2 There was a certain man from Zorah, of the stock of Dan, whose name was Manoah. His wife was barren and had borne no children.

content: 3 An angel of the LORD appeared to the woman and said to her, “You are barren and have borne no children; but you shall conceive and bear a son.
content_old: 3 An angel of the LORD appeared to the woman and said to her, “You are barren and have borne no children; but you shall conceive and bear a son.

content: 4 Now be careful not to drink wine or other intoxicant, or to eat anything unclean.
content_old: 4 Now be careful not to drink wine or other intoxicant, or to eat anything unclean.

content: 5 For you are going to conceive and bear a son; let no razor touch his head, for the boy is to be a nazirite to God from the womb on. He shall be the first to deliver Israel from the Philistines.”
content_old: 5 For you are going to conceive and bear a son; let no razor touch his head, for the boy is to be a nazirite to God from the womb on. He shall be the first to deliver Israel from the Philistines.”

content: 6 The woman went and told her husband, “A man of God came to me; he looked like an angel of God, very frightening. I did not ask him where he was from, nor did he tell me his name.
content_old: 6 The woman went and told her husband, “A man of God came to me; he looked like an angel of God, very frightening. I did not ask him where he was from, nor did he tell me his name.

content: 7 He said to me, ‘You are going to conceive and bear a son. Drink no wine or other intoxicant, and eat nothing unclean, for the boy is to be a nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death!’ ”
content_old: 7 He said to me, ‘You are going to conceive and bear a son. Drink no wine or other intoxicant, and eat nothing unclean, for the boy is to be a nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death!’ ”

content: 8 Manoah pleaded with the LORD. “Oh, my Lord!” he said, “please let the man of God that You sent come to us again, and let him instruct us how to act with the child that is to be born.”
content_old: 8 Manoah pleaded with the LORD. “Oh, my Lord!” he said, “please let the man of God that You sent come to us again, and let him instruct us how to act with the child that is to be born.”

content: 9 God heeded Manoah’s plea, and the angel of God came to the woman again. She was sitting in the field and her husband Manoah was not with her.
content_old: 9 God heeded Manoah’s plea, and the angel of God came to the woman again. She was sitting in the field and her husband Manoah was not with her.

content: 10 The woman ran in haste to tell her husband. She said to him, “The man who came to me before has just appeared to me.”
content_old: 10 The woman ran in haste to tell her husband. She said to him, “The man who came to me before has just appeared to me.”

content: 11 Manoah promptly followed his wife. He came to the man and asked him: “Are you the man who spoke to my wife?” “Yes,” he answered.
content_old: 11 Manoah promptly followed his wife. He came to the man and asked him: “Are you the man who spoke to my wife?” “Yes,” he answered.

content: 12 Then Manoah said, “May your words soon come true! What rules shall be observed for the boy?”
content_old: 12 Then Manoah said, “May your words soon come true! What rules shall be observed for the boy?”

content: 13 The angel of the LORD said to Manoah, “The woman must abstain from all the things against which I warned her.
content_old: 13 The angel of the LORD said to Manoah, “The woman must abstain from all the things against which I warned her.

content: 14 She must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, or drink wine or other intoxicant, or eat anything unclean. She must observe all that I commanded her.”
content_old: 14 She must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, or drink wine or other intoxicant, or eat anything unclean. She must observe all that I commanded her.”

content: 15 Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, “Let us detain you and prepare a kid for you.”
content_old: 15 Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, “Let us detain you and prepare a kid for you.”

content: 16 But the angel of the LORD said to Manoah, “If you detain me, I shall not eat your food; and if you present a burnt offering, offer it to LORD.”—For Manoah did not know that he was an angel of the LORD.
content_old: 16 But the angel of the LORD said to Manoah, “If you detain me, I shall not eat your food; and if you present a burnt offering, offer it to LORD.”—For Manoah did not know that he was an angel of the LORD.

content: 17 So Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, “What is your name? We should like to honor you when your words come true.”
content_old: 17 So Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, “What is your name? We should like to honor you when your words come true.”

content: 18 The angel said to him, “You must not ask for my name; it is unknowable!”
content_old: 18 The angel said to him, “You must not ask for my name; it is unknowable!”

content: 19 Manoah took the kid and the meal offering and offered them up on the rock to the LORD; and a marvelous thing happened while Manoah and his wife looked on.
content_old: 19 Manoah took the kid and the meal offering and offered them up on the rock to the LORD; and a marvelous thing happened while Manoah and his wife looked on.

content: 20 As the flames leaped up from the altar toward the sky, the angel of the LORD ascended in the flames of the altar, while Manoah and his wife looked on; and they flung themselves on their faces to the ground.—
content_old: 20 As the flames leaped up from the altar toward the sky, the angel of the LORD ascended in the flames of the altar, while Manoah and his wife looked on; and they flung themselves on their faces to the ground.—

content: 21 The angel of the LORD never appeared again to Manoah and his wife.—Manoah then realized that it had been an angel of the LORD.
content_old: 21 The angel of the LORD never appeared again to Manoah and his wife.—Manoah then realized that it had been an angel of the LORD.

content: 22 And Manoah said to his wife, “We shall surely die, for we have seen a divine being.”
content_old: 22 And Manoah said to his wife, “We shall surely die, for we have seen a divine being.”

content: 23 But his wife said to him, “Had the LORD meant to take our lives, He would not have accepted a burnt offering and meal offering from us, nor let us see all these things; and He would not have made such an announcement to us.”
content_old: 23 But his wife said to him, “Had the LORD meant to take our lives, He would not have accepted a burnt offering and meal offering from us, nor let us see all these things; and He would not have made such an announcement to us.”

content: 24 The woman bore a son, and she named him Samson. The boy grew up, and the LORD blessed him.
content_old: 24 The woman bore a son, and she named him Samson. The boy grew up, and the LORD blessed him.

content: 1 Once Samson went down to Timnah; and while in Timnah, he noticed a girl among the Philistine women.
content_old: 1 Once Samson went down to Timnah; and while in Timnah, he noticed a girl among the Philistine women.

content: 2 On his return, he told his father and mother, “I noticed one of the Philistine women in Timnah; please get her for me as a wife.”
content_old: 2 On his return, he told his father and mother, “I noticed one of the Philistine women in Timnah; please get her for me as a wife.”

content: 3 His father and mother said to him, “Is there no one among the daughters of your own kinsmen and among all our people, that you must go and take a wife from the uncircumcised Philistines?” But Samson answered his father, “Get me that one, for she is the one that pleases me.”
content_old: 3 His father and mother said to him, “Is there no one among the daughters of your own kinsmen and among all our people, that you must go and take a wife from the uncircumcised Philistines?” But Samson answered his father, “Get me that one, for she is the one that pleases me.”

content: 4 His father and mother did not realize that this was the LORD’s doing: He was seeking a pretext against the Philistines, for the Philistines were ruling over Israel at that time.
content_old: 4 His father and mother did not realize that this was the LORD’s doing: He was seeking a pretext against the Philistines, for the Philistines were ruling over Israel at that time.

content: 5 So Samson and his father and mother went down to Timnah. When he came to the vineyards of Timnah, a full-grown lion came roaring at him.
content_old: 5 So Samson and his father and mother went down to Timnah. When he came to the vineyards of Timnah, a full-grown lion came roaring at him.

content: 6 The spirit of the LORD gripped him, and he tore him asunder with his bare hands as one might tear a kid asunder; but he did not tell his father and mother what he had done.
content_old: 6 The spirit of the LORD gripped him, and he tore him asunder with his bare hands as one might tear a kid asunder; but he did not tell his father and mother what he had done.

content: 7 Then he went down and spoke to the woman, and she pleased Samson.
content_old: 7 Then he went down and spoke to the woman, and she pleased Samson.

content: 8 Returning the following year to marry her, he turned aside to look at the remains of the lion; and in the lion’s skeleton he found a swarm of bees, and honey.
content_old: 8 Returning the following year to marry her, he turned aside to look at the remains of the lion; and in the lion’s skeleton he found a swarm of bees, and honey.

content: 9 He scooped it into his palms and ate it as he went along. When he rejoined his father and mother, he gave them some and they ate it; but he did not tell them that he had scooped the honey out of a lion’s skeleton.
content_old: 9 He scooped it into his palms and ate it as he went along. When he rejoined his father and mother, he gave them some and they ate it; but he did not tell them that he had scooped the honey out of a lion’s skeleton.

content: 10 So his father came down to the woman, and Samson made a feast there, as young men used to do.
content_old: 10 So his father came down to the woman, and Samson made a feast there, as young men used to do.

content: 11 When they saw him, they designated thirty companions to be with him.
content_old: 11 When they saw him, they designated thirty companions to be with him.

content: 12 Then Samson said to them, “Let me propound a riddle to you. If you can give me the right answer during the seven days of the feast, I shall give you thirty linen tunics and thirty sets of clothing;
content_old: 12 Then Samson said to them, “Let me propound a riddle to you. If you can give me the right answer during the seven days of the feast, I shall give you thirty linen tunics and thirty sets of clothing;

content: 13 but if you are not able to tell it to me, you must give me thirty linen tunics and thirty sets of clothing.” And they said to him, “Ask your riddle and we will listen.”
content_old: 13 but if you are not able to tell it to me, you must give me thirty linen tunics and thirty sets of clothing.” And they said to him, “Ask your riddle and we will listen.”

content: 14 So he said to them: “Out of the eater came something to eat, Out of the strong came something sweet.” For three days they could not answer the riddle.
content_old: 14 So he said to them: “Out of the eater came something to eat, Out of the strong came something sweet.” For three days they could not answer the riddle.

content: 15 On the seventh day, they said to Samson’s wife, “Coax your husband to provide us with the answer to the riddle; else we shall put you and your father’s household to the fire; have you invited us here in order to impoverish us?”
content_old: 15 On the seventh day, they said to Samson’s wife, “Coax your husband to provide us with the answer to the riddle; else we shall put you and your father’s household to the fire; have you invited us here in order to impoverish us?”

content: 16 Then Samson’s wife harassed him with tears, and she said, “You really hate me, you don’t love me. You asked my countrymen a riddle, and you didn’t tell me the answer.” He replied, “I haven’t even told my father and mother; shall I tell you?”
content_old: 16 Then Samson’s wife harassed him with tears, and she said, “You really hate me, you don’t love me. You asked my countrymen a riddle, and you didn’t tell me the answer.” He replied, “I haven’t even told my father and mother; shall I tell you?”

content: 17 During the rest of the seven days of the feast she continued to harass him with her tears, and on the seventh day he told her, because she nagged him so. And she explained the riddle to her countrymen.
content_old: 17 During the rest of the seven days of the feast she continued to harass him with her tears, and on the seventh day he told her, because she nagged him so. And she explained the riddle to her countrymen.

content: 18 On the seventh day, before the sunset, the townsmen said to him: “What is sweeter than honey, And what is stronger than a lion?” He responded: “Had you not plowed with my heifer, You would not have guessed my riddle!”
content_old: 18 On the seventh day, before the sunset, the townsmen said to him: “What is sweeter than honey, And what is stronger than a lion?” He responded: “Had you not plowed with my heifer, You would not have guessed my riddle!”

content: 19 The spirit of the LORD gripped him. He went down to Ashkelon and killed thirty of its men. He stripped them and gave the sets of clothing to those who had answered the riddle. And he left in a rage for his father’s house.
content_old: 19 The spirit of the LORD gripped him. He went down to Ashkelon and killed thirty of its men. He stripped them and gave the sets of clothing to those who had answered the riddle. And he left in a rage for his father’s house.

content: 1 Some time later, in the season of the wheat harvest, Samson came to visit his wife, bringing a kid as a gift. He said, “Let me go into the chamber to my wife.” But her father would not let him go in.
content_old: 1 Some time later, in the season of the wheat harvest, Samson came to visit his wife, bringing a kid as a gift. He said, “Let me go into the chamber to my wife.” But her father would not let him go in.

content: 2 “I was sure,” said her father, “that you had taken a dislike to her, so I gave her to your wedding companion. But her younger sister is more beautiful than she; let her become your wife instead.”
content_old: 2 “I was sure,” said her father, “that you had taken a dislike to her, so I gave her to your wedding companion. But her younger sister is more beautiful than she; let her become your wife instead.”

content: 3 Thereupon Samson declared, “Now the Philistines can have no claim against me for the harm I shall do them.”
content_old: 3 Thereupon Samson declared, “Now the Philistines can have no claim against me for the harm I shall do them.”

content: 4 Samson went and caught three hundred foxes. He took torches and, turning the foxes tail to tail, he placed a torch between each pair of tails.
content_old: 4 Samson went and caught three hundred foxes. He took torches and, turning the foxes tail to tail, he placed a torch between each pair of tails.

content: 5 He lit the torches and turned the foxes loose among the standing grain of the Philistines, setting fire to stacked grain, standing grain, vineyards, and olive trees.
content_old: 5 He lit the torches and turned the foxes loose among the standing grain of the Philistines, setting fire to stacked grain, standing grain, vineyards, and olive trees.

content: 6 The Philistines asked, “Who did this?” And they were told, “It was Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, who took Samson’s wife and gave her to his wedding companion.” Thereupon the Philistines came up and put her and her father to the fire.
content_old: 6 The Philistines asked, “Who did this?” And they were told, “It was Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, who took Samson’s wife and gave her to his wedding companion.” Thereupon the Philistines came up and put her and her father to the fire.

content: 7 Samson said to them, “If that is how you act, I will not rest until I have taken revenge on you.”
content_old: 7 Samson said to them, “If that is how you act, I will not rest until I have taken revenge on you.”

content: 8 He gave them a sound and thorough thrashing. Then he went down and stayed in the cave of the rock of Etam.
content_old: 8 He gave them a sound and thorough thrashing. Then he went down and stayed in the cave of the rock of Etam.

content: 9 The Philistines came up, pitched camp in Judah and spread out over Lehi.
content_old: 9 The Philistines came up, pitched camp in Judah and spread out over Lehi.

content: 10 The men of Judah asked, “Why have you come up against us?” They answered, “We have come to take Samson prisoner, and to do to him as he did to us.”
content_old: 10 The men of Judah asked, “Why have you come up against us?” They answered, “We have come to take Samson prisoner, and to do to him as he did to us.”

content: 11 Thereupon three thousand men of Judah went down to the cave of the rock of Etam, and they said to Samson, “You knew that the Philistines rule over us; why have you done this to us?” He replied, “As they did to me, so I did to them.”
content_old: 11 Thereupon three thousand men of Judah went down to the cave of the rock of Etam, and they said to Samson, “You knew that the Philistines rule over us; why have you done this to us?” He replied, “As they did to me, so I did to them.”

content: 12 “We have come down,” they told him, “to take you prisoner and to hand you over to the Philistines.” “But swear to me,” said Samson to them, “that you yourselves will not attack me.”
content_old: 12 “We have come down,” they told him, “to take you prisoner and to hand you over to the Philistines.” “But swear to me,” said Samson to them, “that you yourselves will not attack me.”

content: 13 “We won’t,” they replied. “We will only take you prisoner and hand you over to them; we will not slay you.” So they bound him with two new ropes and brought him up from the rock.
content_old: 13 “We won’t,” they replied. “We will only take you prisoner and hand you over to them; we will not slay you.” So they bound him with two new ropes and brought him up from the rock.

content: 14 When he reached Lehi, the Philistines came shouting to meet him. Thereupon the spirit of the LORD gripped him, and the ropes on his arms became like flax that catches fire; the bonds melted off his hands.
content_old: 14 When he reached Lehi, the Philistines came shouting to meet him. Thereupon the spirit of the LORD gripped him, and the ropes on his arms became like flax that catches fire; the bonds melted off his hands.

content: 15 He came upon a fresh jawbone of an ass and he picked it up; and with it he killed a thousand men.
content_old: 15 He came upon a fresh jawbone of an ass and he picked it up; and with it he killed a thousand men.

content: 16 Then Samson said: “With the jaw of an ass, Mass upon mass! With the jaw of an ass I have slain a thousand men.”
content_old: 16 Then Samson said: “With the jaw of an ass, Mass upon mass! With the jaw of an ass I have slain a thousand men.”

content: 17 As he finished speaking, he threw the jawbone away; hence that place was called Ramath-lehi.
content_old: 17 As he finished speaking, he threw the jawbone away; hence that place was called Ramath-lehi.

content: 18 He was very thirsty and he called to the LORD, “You Yourself have granted this great victory through Your servant; and must I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised?”
content_old: 18 He was very thirsty and he called to the LORD, “You Yourself have granted this great victory through Your servant; and must I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised?”

content: 19 So God split open the hollow which is at Lehi, and the water gushed out of it; he drank, regained his strength, and revived. That is why it is called to this day “En-hakkore of Lehi.”
content_old: 19 So God split open the hollow which is at Lehi, and the water gushed out of it; he drank, regained his strength, and revived. That is why it is called to this day “En-hakkore of Lehi.”

content: 1 Once Samson went to Gaza; there he met a whore and slept with her.
content_old: 1 Once Samson went to Gaza; there he met a whore and slept with her.

content: 2 The Gazites learned that Samson had come there, so they gathered and lay in ambush for him in the town gate the whole night; and all night long they kept whispering to each other, “When daylight comes, we’ll kill him.”
content_old: 2 The Gazites learned that Samson had come there, so they gathered and lay in ambush for him in the town gate the whole night; and all night long they kept whispering to each other, “When daylight comes, we’ll kill him.”

content: 3 But Samson lay in bed only till midnight. At midnight he got up, grasped the doors of the town gate together with the two gateposts, and pulled them out along with the bar. He placed them on his shoulders and carried them off to the top of the hill that is near Hebron.
content_old: 3 But Samson lay in bed only till midnight. At midnight he got up, grasped the doors of the town gate together with the two gateposts, and pulled them out along with the bar. He placed them on his shoulders and carried them off to the top of the hill that is near Hebron.

content: 4 After that, he fell in love with a woman in the Wadi Sorek, named Delilah.
content_old: 4 After that, he fell in love with a woman in the Wadi Sorek, named Delilah.

content: 5 The lords of the Philistines went up to her and said, “Coax him and find out what makes him so strong, and how we can overpower him, tie him up, and make him helpless; and we’ll each give you eleven hundred shekels of silver.”
content_old: 5 The lords of the Philistines went up to her and said, “Coax him and find out what makes him so strong, and how we can overpower him, tie him up, and make him helpless; and we’ll each give you eleven hundred shekels of silver.”

content: 6 So Delilah said to Samson, “Tell me, what makes you so strong? And how could you be tied up and made helpless?”
content_old: 6 So Delilah said to Samson, “Tell me, what makes you so strong? And how could you be tied up and made helpless?”

content: 7 Samson replied, “If I were to be tied with seven fresh tendons that had not been dried, I should become as weak as an ordinary man.”
content_old: 7 Samson replied, “If I were to be tied with seven fresh tendons that had not been dried, I should become as weak as an ordinary man.”

content: 8 So the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven fresh tendons that had not been dried. She bound him with them,
content_old: 8 So the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven fresh tendons that had not been dried. She bound him with them,

content: 9 while an ambush was waiting in her room. Then she called out to him, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” Whereat he pulled the tendons apart, as a strand of tow comes apart at the touch of fire. So the secret of his strength remained unknown.
content_old: 9 while an ambush was waiting in her room. Then she called out to him, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” Whereat he pulled the tendons apart, as a strand of tow comes apart at the touch of fire. So the secret of his strength remained unknown.

content: 10 Then Delilah said to Samson, “Oh, you deceived me; you lied to me! Do tell me now how you could be tied up.”
content_old: 10 Then Delilah said to Samson, “Oh, you deceived me; you lied to me! Do tell me now how you could be tied up.”

content: 11 He said, “If I were to be bound with new ropes that had never been used, I would become as weak as an ordinary man.”
content_old: 11 He said, “If I were to be bound with new ropes that had never been used, I would become as weak as an ordinary man.”

content: 12 So Delilah took new ropes and bound him with them, while an ambush was waiting in a room. And she cried, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” But he tore them off his arms like a thread.
content_old: 12 So Delilah took new ropes and bound him with them, while an ambush was waiting in a room. And she cried, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” But he tore them off his arms like a thread.

content: 13 Then Delilah said to Samson, “You have been deceiving me all along; you have been lying to me! Tell me, how could you be tied up?” He answered her, “If you weave seven locks of my head into the web.”
content_old: 13 Then Delilah said to Samson, “You have been deceiving me all along; you have been lying to me! Tell me, how could you be tied up?” He answered her, “If you weave seven locks of my head into the web.”

content: 14 And she pinned it with a peg and cried to him, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” Awaking from his sleep, he pulled out the peg, the loom, and the web.
content_old: 14 And she pinned it with a peg and cried to him, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” Awaking from his sleep, he pulled out the peg, the loom, and the web.

content: 15 Then she said to him, “How can you say you love me, when you don’t confide in me? This makes three times that you’ve deceived me and haven’t told me what makes you so strong.”
content_old: 15 Then she said to him, “How can you say you love me, when you don’t confide in me? This makes three times that you’ve deceived me and haven’t told me what makes you so strong.”

content: 16 Finally, after she had nagged him and pressed him constantly, he was wearied to death
content_old: 16 Finally, after she had nagged him and pressed him constantly, he was wearied to death

content: 17 and he confided everything to her. He said to her, “No razor has ever touched my head, for I have been a nazirite to God since I was in my mother’s womb. If my hair were cut, my strength would leave me and I should become as weak as an ordinary man.”
content_old: 17 and he confided everything to her. He said to her, “No razor has ever touched my head, for I have been a nazirite to God since I was in my mother’s womb. If my hair were cut, my strength would leave me and I should become as weak as an ordinary man.”

content: 18 Sensing that he had confided everything to her, Delilah sent for the lords of the Philistines, with this message: “Come up once more, for he has confided everything to me.” And the lords of the Philistines came up and brought the money with them.
content_old: 18 Sensing that he had confided everything to her, Delilah sent for the lords of the Philistines, with this message: “Come up once more, for he has confided everything to me.” And the lords of the Philistines came up and brought the money with them.

content: 19 She lulled him to sleep on her lap. Then she called in a man, and she had him cut off the seven locks of his head; thus she weakened him and made him helpless: his strength slipped away from him.
content_old: 19 She lulled him to sleep on her lap. Then she called in a man, and she had him cut off the seven locks of his head; thus she weakened him and made him helpless: his strength slipped away from him.

content: 20 She cried, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” And he awoke from his sleep, thinking he would break loose and shake himself free as he had the other times. For he did not know that the LORD had departed from him.
content_old: 20 She cried, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” And he awoke from his sleep, thinking he would break loose and shake himself free as he had the other times. For he did not know that the LORD had departed from him.

content: 21 The Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes. They brought him down to Gaza and shackled him in bronze fetters, and he became a mill slave in the prison.
content_old: 21 The Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes. They brought him down to Gaza and shackled him in bronze fetters, and he became a mill slave in the prison.

content: 22 After his hair was cut off, it began to grow back.
content_old: 22 After his hair was cut off, it began to grow back.

content: 23 Now the lords of the Philistines gathered to offer a great sacrifice to their god Dagon and to make merry. They chanted, “Our god has delivered into our hands Our enemy Samson.”
content_old: 23 Now the lords of the Philistines gathered to offer a great sacrifice to their god Dagon and to make merry. They chanted, “Our god has delivered into our hands Our enemy Samson.”

content: 24 When the people saw him, they sang praises to their god, chanting, “Our god has delivered into our hands The enemy who devastated our land, And who slew so many of us.”
content_old: 24 When the people saw him, they sang praises to their god, chanting, “Our god has delivered into our hands The enemy who devastated our land, And who slew so many of us.”

content: 25 As their spirits rose, they said, “Call Samson here and let him dance for us.” Samson was fetched from the prison, and he danced for them. Then they put him between the pillars.
content_old: 25 As their spirits rose, they said, “Call Samson here and let him dance for us.” Samson was fetched from the prison, and he danced for them. Then they put him between the pillars.

content: 26 And Samson said to the boy who was leading him by the hand, “Let go of me and let me feel the pillars that the temple rests upon, that I may lean on them.”
content_old: 26 And Samson said to the boy who was leading him by the hand, “Let go of me and let me feel the pillars that the temple rests upon, that I may lean on them.”

content: 27 Now the temple was full of men and women; all the lords of the Philistines were there, and there were some three thousand men and women on the roof watching Samson dance.
content_old: 27 Now the temple was full of men and women; all the lords of the Philistines were there, and there were some three thousand men and women on the roof watching Samson dance.

content: 28 Then Samson called to the LORD, “O Lord GOD! Please remember me, and give me strength just this once, O God, to take revenge of the Philistines, if only for one of my two eyes.”
content_old: 28 Then Samson called to the LORD, “O Lord GOD! Please remember me, and give me strength just this once, O God, to take revenge of the Philistines, if only for one of my two eyes.”

content: 29 He embraced the two middle pillars that the temple rested upon, one with his right arm and one with his left, and leaned against them;
content_old: 29 He embraced the two middle pillars that the temple rested upon, one with his right arm and one with his left, and leaned against them;

content: 30 Samson cried, “Let me die with the Philistines!” and he pulled with all his might. The temple came crashing down on the lords and on all the people in it. Those who were slain by him as he died outnumbered those who had been slain by him when he lived.
content_old: 30 Samson cried, “Let me die with the Philistines!” and he pulled with all his might. The temple came crashing down on the lords and on all the people in it. Those who were slain by him as he died outnumbered those who had been slain by him when he lived.

content: 1 There was a man in the hill country of Ephraim whose name was Micah.
content_old: 1 There was a man in the hill country of Ephraim whose name was Micah.

content: 2 He said to his mother, “The eleven hundred shekels of silver that were taken from you, so that you uttered an imprecation which you repeated in my hearing—I have that silver; I took it.” “Blessed of the LORD be my son,” said his mother.
content_old: 2 He said to his mother, “The eleven hundred shekels of silver that were taken from you, so that you uttered an imprecation which you repeated in my hearing—I have that silver; I took it.” “Blessed of the LORD be my son,” said his mother.

content: 3 He returned the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother; but his mother said, “I herewith consecrate the silver to the LORD, transferring it to my son to make a sculptured image and a molten image. I now return it to you.”
content_old: 3 He returned the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother; but his mother said, “I herewith consecrate the silver to the LORD, transferring it to my son to make a sculptured image and a molten image. I now return it to you.”

content: 4 So when he gave the silver back to his mother, his mother took two hundred shekels of silver and gave it to a smith. He made of it a sculptured image and a molten image, which were kept in the house of Micah.
content_old: 4 So when he gave the silver back to his mother, his mother took two hundred shekels of silver and gave it to a smith. He made of it a sculptured image and a molten image, which were kept in the house of Micah.

content: 5 Now the man Micah had a house of God; he had made an ephod and teraphim and he had inducted one of his sons to be his priest.
content_old: 5 Now the man Micah had a house of God; he had made an ephod and teraphim and he had inducted one of his sons to be his priest.

content: 6 In those days there was no king in Israel; every man did as he pleased.
content_old: 6 In those days there was no king in Israel; every man did as he pleased.

content: 7 There was a young man from Bethlehem of Judah, from the clan seat of Judah; he was a Levite and had resided there as a sojourner.
content_old: 7 There was a young man from Bethlehem of Judah, from the clan seat of Judah; he was a Levite and had resided there as a sojourner.

content: 8 This man had left the town of Bethlehem of Judah to take up residence wherever he could find a place. On his way, he came to the house of Micah in the hill country of Ephraim.
content_old: 8 This man had left the town of Bethlehem of Judah to take up residence wherever he could find a place. On his way, he came to the house of Micah in the hill country of Ephraim.

content: 9 “Where do you come from?” Micah asked him. He replied, “I am a Levite from Bethlehem of Judah, and I am traveling to take up residence wherever I can find a place.”
content_old: 9 “Where do you come from?” Micah asked him. He replied, “I am a Levite from Bethlehem of Judah, and I am traveling to take up residence wherever I can find a place.”

content: 10 “Stay with me,” Micah said to him, “and be a father and a priest to me, and I will pay you ten shekels of silver a year, an allowance of clothing, and your food.” The Levite went.
content_old: 10 “Stay with me,” Micah said to him, “and be a father and a priest to me, and I will pay you ten shekels of silver a year, an allowance of clothing, and your food.” The Levite went.

content: 11 The Levite agreed to stay with the man, and the youth became like one of his own sons.
content_old: 11 The Levite agreed to stay with the man, and the youth became like one of his own sons.

content: 12 Micah inducted the Levite, and the young man became his priest and remained in Micah’s shrine.
content_old: 12 Micah inducted the Levite, and the young man became his priest and remained in Micah’s shrine.

content: 1 In those days there was no king in Israel, and in those days the tribe of Dan was seeking a territory in which to settle; for to that day no territory had fallen to their lot among the tribes of Israel.
content_old: 1 In those days there was no king in Israel, and in those days the tribe of Dan was seeking a territory in which to settle; for to that day no territory had fallen to their lot among the tribes of Israel.

content: 2 The Danites sent out five of their number, from their clan seat at Zorah and Eshtaol—valiant men—to spy out the land and explore it. “Go,” they told them, “and explore the land.” When they had advanced into the hill country of Ephraim as far as the house of Micah, they stopped there for the night.
content_old: 2 The Danites sent out five of their number, from their clan seat at Zorah and Eshtaol—valiant men—to spy out the land and explore it. “Go,” they told them, “and explore the land.” When they had advanced into the hill country of Ephraim as far as the house of Micah, they stopped there for the night.

content: 3 While in the vicinity of Micah’s house, they recognized the speech of the young Levite, so they went over and asked him, “Who brought you to these parts? What are you doing in this place? What is your business here?”
content_old: 3 While in the vicinity of Micah’s house, they recognized the speech of the young Levite, so they went over and asked him, “Who brought you to these parts? What are you doing in this place? What is your business here?”

content: 4 He replied, “Thus and thus Micah did for me—he hired me and I became his priest.”
content_old: 4 He replied, “Thus and thus Micah did for me—he hired me and I became his priest.”

content: 5 They said to him, “Please, inquire of God; we would like to know if the mission on which we are going will be successful.”
content_old: 5 They said to him, “Please, inquire of God; we would like to know if the mission on which we are going will be successful.”

content: 6 “Go in peace,” the priest said to them, “the LORD views with favor the mission you are going on.”
content_old: 6 “Go in peace,” the priest said to them, “the LORD views with favor the mission you are going on.”

content: 7 The five men went on and came to Laish. They observed the people in it dwelling carefree, after the manner of the Sidonians, a tranquil and unsuspecting people, with no one in the land to molest them and with no hereditary ruler. Moreover, they were distant from the Sidonians and had no dealings with anybody.
content_old: 7 The five men went on and came to Laish. They observed the people in it dwelling carefree, after the manner of the Sidonians, a tranquil and unsuspecting people, with no one in the land to molest them and with no hereditary ruler. Moreover, they were distant from the Sidonians and had no dealings with anybody.

content: 8 When came back to their kinsmen at Zorah and Eshtaol, their kinsmen asked them, “How did you fare?”
content_old: 8 When came back to their kinsmen at Zorah and Eshtaol, their kinsmen asked them, “How did you fare?”

content: 9 They replied, “Let us go at once and attack them! For we found that the land was very good, and you are sitting idle! Don’t delay; go and invade the land and take possession of it,
content_old: 9 They replied, “Let us go at once and attack them! For we found that the land was very good, and you are sitting idle! Don’t delay; go and invade the land and take possession of it,

content: 10 for God has delivered it into your hand. When you come, you will come to an unsuspecting people; and the land is spacious and nothing on earth is lacking there.”
content_old: 10 for God has delivered it into your hand. When you come, you will come to an unsuspecting people; and the land is spacious and nothing on earth is lacking there.”

content: 11 They departed from there, from the clan seat of the Danites, from Zorah and Eshtaol, six hundred strong, girt with weapons of war.
content_old: 11 They departed from there, from the clan seat of the Danites, from Zorah and Eshtaol, six hundred strong, girt with weapons of war.

content: 12 They went up and encamped at Kiriath-jearim in Judah. That is why that place is called “the Camp of Dan” to this day; it lies west of Kiriath-jearim.
content_old: 12 They went up and encamped at Kiriath-jearim in Judah. That is why that place is called “the Camp of Dan” to this day; it lies west of Kiriath-jearim.

content: 13 From there they passed on to the hill country of Ephraim and arrived at the house of Micah.
content_old: 13 From there they passed on to the hill country of Ephraim and arrived at the house of Micah.

content: 14 Here the five men who had gone to spy out the Laish region remarked to their kinsmen, “Do you know, there is an ephod in these houses, and teraphim, and a sculptured image and a molten image? Now you know what you have to do.”
content_old: 14 Here the five men who had gone to spy out the Laish region remarked to their kinsmen, “Do you know, there is an ephod in these houses, and teraphim, and a sculptured image and a molten image? Now you know what you have to do.”

content: 15 So they turned off there and entered the home of the young Levite at Micah’s house and greeted him.
content_old: 15 So they turned off there and entered the home of the young Levite at Micah’s house and greeted him.

content: 16 The six hundred Danite men, girt with their weapons of war, stood at the entrance of the gate,
content_old: 16 The six hundred Danite men, girt with their weapons of war, stood at the entrance of the gate,

content: 17 while the five men who had gone to spy out the land went inside and took the sculptured image, the ephod, the teraphim, and the molten image. The priest was standing at the entrance of the gate, and the six hundred men girt with their weapons of war,
content_old: 17 while the five men who had gone to spy out the land went inside and took the sculptured image, the ephod, the teraphim, and the molten image. The priest was standing at the entrance of the gate, and the six hundred men girt with their weapons of war,

content: 18 while those men entered Micah’s house and took the sculptured image, the molten image, the ephod, and the household gods. The priest said to them, “What are you doing?”
content_old: 18 while those men entered Micah’s house and took the sculptured image, the molten image, the ephod, and the household gods. The priest said to them, “What are you doing?”

content: 19 But they said to him, “Be quiet; put your hand on your mouth! Come with us and be our father and priest. Would you rather be priest to one man’s household or be priest to a tribe and clan in Israel?”
content_old: 19 But they said to him, “Be quiet; put your hand on your mouth! Come with us and be our father and priest. Would you rather be priest to one man’s household or be priest to a tribe and clan in Israel?”

content: 20 The priest was delighted. He took the ephod, the household gods, and the sculptured image, and he joined the people.
content_old: 20 The priest was delighted. He took the ephod, the household gods, and the sculptured image, and he joined the people.

content: 21 They set out again, placing the children, the cattle, and their household goods in front.
content_old: 21 They set out again, placing the children, the cattle, and their household goods in front.

content: 22 They had already gone some distance from Micah’s house, when the men in the houses near Micah’s mustered and caught up with the Danites.
content_old: 22 They had already gone some distance from Micah’s house, when the men in the houses near Micah’s mustered and caught up with the Danites.

content: 23 They called out to the Danites, who turned around and said to Micah, “What’s the matter? Why have you mustered?”
content_old: 23 They called out to the Danites, who turned around and said to Micah, “What’s the matter? Why have you mustered?”

content: 24 He said, “You have taken my priest and the gods that I made, and walked off! What do I have left? How can you ask, ‘What’s the matter’?”
content_old: 24 He said, “You have taken my priest and the gods that I made, and walked off! What do I have left? How can you ask, ‘What’s the matter’?”

content: 25 But the Danites replied, “Don’t do any shouting at us, or some desperate men might attack you, and you and your family would lose your lives.”
content_old: 25 But the Danites replied, “Don’t do any shouting at us, or some desperate men might attack you, and you and your family would lose your lives.”

content: 26 So Micah, realizing that they were stronger than he, turned back and went home; and the Danites went on their way,
content_old: 26 So Micah, realizing that they were stronger than he, turned back and went home; and the Danites went on their way,

content: 27 taking the things Micah had made and the priest he had acquired. They proceeded to Laish, a people tranquil and unsuspecting, and they put them to the sword and burned down the town.
content_old: 27 taking the things Micah had made and the priest he had acquired. They proceeded to Laish, a people tranquil and unsuspecting, and they put them to the sword and burned down the town.

content: 28 There was none to come to the rescue, for it was distant from Sidon and they had no dealings with anyone; it lay in the valley of Beth-rehob. They rebuilt the town and settled there,
content_old: 28 There was none to come to the rescue, for it was distant from Sidon and they had no dealings with anyone; it lay in the valley of Beth-rehob. They rebuilt the town and settled there,

content: 29 and they named the town Dan, after their ancestor Dan who was Israel’s son. Originally, however, the name of the town was Laish.
content_old: 29 and they named the town Dan, after their ancestor Dan who was Israel’s son. Originally, however, the name of the town was Laish.

content: 30 The Danites set up the sculptured image for themselves; and Jonathan son of Gershom son of Manasseh, and his descendants, served as priests to the Danite tribe until the land went into exile.
content_old: 30 The Danites set up the sculptured image for themselves; and Jonathan son of Gershom son of Manasseh, and his descendants, served as priests to the Danite tribe until the land went into exile.

content: 1 In those days, when there was no king in Israel, a Levite residing at the other end of the hill country of Ephraim took to himself a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.
content_old: 1 In those days, when there was no king in Israel, a Levite residing at the other end of the hill country of Ephraim took to himself a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.

content: 2 Once his concubine deserted him, leaving him for her father’s house in Bethlehem in Judah; and she stayed there a full four months.
content_old: 2 Once his concubine deserted him, leaving him for her father’s house in Bethlehem in Judah; and she stayed there a full four months.
